Description: Lionbridge AI are looking to hire a Senior Data Analyst, to join their busy team in Ballina/Part remote-working.. . Our company mission is to break down barriers and build bridges. Join us today to continue our mission.. . As a senior team member, you'll be working in Lionbridge's AI business helping shape the Strategy and Transformation of the AI analytics function. The Lionbridge AI business is an exciting and diverse business, full of talented people with a can do attitude. We're doing something new within Lionbridge that will benefit our customers.. . You will get the opportunity to work on large datasets that are generated from our global communities working with some of the largest global tech customers in the world. The Insights shared back to our customers can provide impactful changes to consumers located across the globe through required products used in everyday life.. . This also an opportunity to shape the strategy, platform and toolsets used within the Analytics function in addition to mentoring team members on best practice techniques.. . You will be a senior member of the Data & AI Solutions function, working closely with internal functions and the business leadership. This is a customer facing role where you will have the unique opportunity to work with the largest tech customers on the planet in understanding their needs and develop ground-breaking solutions to address those needs.. . Strong data visualisation skills. Experience of working in a customer facing role with to understand customer requirements and translate them into solutions. Competent in designing and building innovative data and AI products. Strong communication and data presentation skills with the ability to build convincing recommendations and sell these to a non-technical audience. Experience in developing senior stake holder relationships. Flexible and agile work skills - comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment. About Us. . IHS Markit is the largest and leading provider of research to the solar and energy storage industry and is currently looking to recruit a senior market analyst to support its rapidly growing and successful team. The team is located across various locations in Europe, China, India and USA.. . Company Overview. . Founded in 2000, Analytic Partners (AP) has grown to be the independent global leader in analytics consulting and technology. We help top-tier companies adapt to the rapidly evolving world of data, analytics, and strategic and tactical data-driven decisioning. We are fast growing with global operations across our full-service offices in New York City, Denver, Charlottesville, Dublin, Sydney, Hong Kong, Singapore, and Shanghai. We are the premier provider of integrated analytic technology and services, leveraging adaptive modeling techniques to help companies generate better business results, drive growth, and, ultimately, grow closer to their customers.. . Analytic Partners is a Certified Women-Owned Business, and a recognized leader in marketing measurement and optimization, and named a Leader in The Forrester Wave™ Marketing Measurement and Optimization Q1 2020, with top ranks in Strategy and Current Offering categories among all evaluated vendors.. . Our Values. . Our differentiator is – Our People! We hire the brightest talent and develop them into leaders. We foster a culture of PEOPLE, PASSION and GROWTH.. . People: We value our people, clients, and partners. Passion: We love what we do. Growth: Unlimited growth means unlimited potential. . AP is a client-focused, team-oriented organization where innovation and results are rewarded, and individuals can chart the course of their own careers.. . Team & Position Overview. . The Client Engagement Team (CET) is the analytic and consultative backbone of Analytic Partners. We believe that the most successful way to service our clients is to employ a business model where the people who are partnering with the client are the same as the people who prepare, analyze, and deliver insightful, data-driven results and guide clients to use our technology solutions to make optimal decisions. Analytic Partners does not offshore or outsource any of our work; it is all done in-house. Therefore, this high-touch service requires a passion for analytics, balanced with strong communication, a consultative approach, and the ability to deliver a software plus services solution, all to enable our clients to grow their ROI.. . At Analytic Partners you will advise and partner with large, well-known businesses, many of which are Fortune 500 or 100 companies. Your work will help influence their strategic and tactical planning for marketing and beyond, creating growth opportunities which are measured in the tens of millions of dollars. We develop relationships with our clients and meet with senior audiences, from brand managers to media directors to CMOs and CEOs. You will learn, measure, and be an expert on marketing, from the basics to contributing to the latest innovations and developments. Our impactful insights are derived from our ability to build accurate and predictive models. A deep understanding of our clients’ data and business, in combination with our customized approach, allows us to “solve the puzzle” of what drives sales, appointments, accounts, brand health, or whatever it is our client wants to do more of.. . The Marketing Science Analyst role covers a range of responsibilities in which you will lead the day-to-day elements of projects from building advanced analytic models that leverage Big Data to creating deliverables through presentations and technology that communicate impactful insights and recommendations to our clients. You will be trained and resourced on our industry leading advanced analytics and big data solutions to help client companies generate better business results, drive growth, and, ultimately, grow closer to their customers. You will work in a dynamic collaborative team environment on national and multi-national client business.. . You Will Own & Collaborate On. . Partner with clients to help them optimize marketing investments and more using sophisticated analytic methodologies combine with technology and advisory services. Regularly communicate with clients and additional partners to collect, harmonize & review data, build models, interpret results, and formulate key insights. Develop charts, reports and client presentations. Train and guide clients on the adoption of software to run simulations or optimizations for various types of investment planning scenarios. Ensure statistical models and all deliverables are of high quality and meet the internal quality control guidelines. Collaborate as part of a team to drive analyses and insights that lead to more informed decisions and improved business performance. Ensure AP meets or exceeds client expectations on both deliverable milestones and quality. Work with team to continuously evolve our statistical methodologies and develop new ways of efficiently and effectively solving complex client business problems. Collaborate with the Technology Engineering Team (R&D) to help develop new tools and capabilities. . . Qualifications & Experience You Will Need. . Fluent in a second European language highly preferred. Bachelor’s degree or above (ideal areas of study/related study include: Business Analytics and Management, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, and/or Marketing). 1-3+ years of experience with any combination of advanced and predictive analytics, marketing analytics, and analytic techniques for marketing, customer, and business applications. Experience working with big data; building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures, and data sets. Strong working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, and SQL; Additional tools such as VBA, R, and/or Python are a plus but not required. Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Experience working independently on analytical tasks to build a story. Comfortable working with a team developing and presenting presentations using insights derived from analytics. The ability to occasionally travel domestically and/or internationally. Strong verbal and written communication skills internally and externally. An understanding of how to use data to solve complex business questions and drive business solutions. . You must be eligible to work in Ireland on an unlimited basis to be considered for this job.. . Job Summary. . Requisition Number: MARKE01011. Job Category: Client Engagement Team. Schedule: Full-Time. Show more

It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of 1 billion. Nearly half of Verizon Media employees are building the code and platforms that help us achieve that. Whether you’re looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process 4 trillion data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? As Verizon’s media unit, our brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and more help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact, while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. With technologies like XR, AI, machine-learning, and 5G, we’re transforming media for tomorrow, too. We're creators and coders, dreamers and doers creating what's next in content, advertising and technology.. . Data Engineer, Ad Platforms. . Job Description. . A Little About Us. . Verizon Media brands comprise some of the premier destinations on the Internet -- Yahoo, Techcrunch, AOL, and more. This means that we rely on massively scalable, widely distributed, highly performant systems. If you want to help solve complex problems for systems like these, we are looking for you.. . Verizon Media's Business Analytics and Insights team works on one of the biggest online advertising and audience data sets in the world. We are responsible for providing fast, clean, and relevant data for Verizon Media’s advertising businesses as well as key measurements and insights about the users of Verizon Media. We are developing next generation technologies to enrich our advertiser and user experience through complex, scalable data platforms, with ever growing and interesting challenges.. . The team is seeking a Data Engineer/Analyst to support Verizon Media Ad Platforms by building and maintaining data pipelines, reporting, and dashboards, as well as conducting ad hoc analyses to understand complex marketplace trends.. . A Lot About You. . Values: You have a strong work ethic and strong core values (honesty, integrity, objectivity). Curiosity & Problem-Solving: You are always curious, you love data, and you love exploring new datasets to enrich your understanding. Quantitative Approach: You're able to focus on the numbers and take an objective view of a complex and dynamic business. Dealing with Ambiguity: Ability to take poorly defined problems and provide solutions that address the spirit of the question (without needing all the details). Agility & Speed:Thrives in fast-paced environments and can iterate quickly.. Communication: You're good at explaining and illustrating complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences. Organization: Ability to juggle multiple projects, with a strong habit of communicating early and often. Self-Starter: You have a willingness to roll up your sleeves to get things done. You’re always thinking about ways to improve and not afraid of pursuing new ideas. Teamwork: You make those around you better and enjoy working collaboratively. You are always thinking of how your work can impact the broader organization. . . Responsibilities. . Understand the Business and Data: Support Business subject matter experts to discover insights into advertiser, publisher, product, user, and auction dynamics. Understand the underlying data systems and schemas that can inform these measurements.. Analysis & Dashboarding: Conduct ad hoc investigations and create ongoing dashboards and reports that provide analysis and commentary, explaining business trends and market drivers using intuitive visualizations (Looker, Tableau, R, Spreadsheets, etc). Data Engineering: Develop data pipelines (ETL) from multiple data sources with design, performance, and end customer in mind (Pig, Hive, Oozie, Python, SQL, PLSQL, etc). Partner with engineering teams across data sources to address technical and functional requirements.. Investigation & Troubleshooting: Expert at “cracking” complex business and analytical problems. In particular, experience in working with large data sets, identifying and troubleshooting data discrepancies via automated scripts, developing data models/schemas, and working cross-functionally towards resolution.. Data Governance: Streamline data & tools footprint in alignment with Data Governance objectives.. . . Qualifications. . BS/MS in quantitative field or equivalent experience. 5+ years of experience in analytics, data engineering, and dashboarding. Experience working with large and complex data sets. Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc). Strong database skills (e.g. MySQL, Oracle) and familiarity with spreadsheets (Excel, Google Sheets, Pivot Tables, Formulas). Experience with programming languages such as Perl/Python/R/Java is preferred. Experience with the Hadoop ecosystem is preferred, but not required (Pig, Hive, Presto, Oozie). Experience in the online advertising industry preferred, but not required. Demonstrated use of analytics, metrics, and benchmarking to drive decisions. . . At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 35,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.. . At Lilly, we believe in the talent of our workforce. One of the best ways to utilize and develop that talent is to use our existing workforce to fill new and/or open positions. If you are looking for a new position within Lilly, you can view and apply to open roles posted in the internal job posting system. You must meet the minimum qualifications outlined in the job description and have/obtain work authorization in the country the position is located in order to be considered. When applying internally for a position, your current supervisor will receive notification that you have applied to the position. We encourage employees to discuss the opportunity with their supervisor prior to applying.. . Path/Level. . P3. . Note: Employees hired on banded positions (ex: P1-P3, R1-R2, B1-B3, etc.) transfer at their current level, despite the level indicated on the job posting. For example, if a P2 candidate is selected for a P1-P3 banded position, the candidate will remain a P2 in the new role.. . At Lilly, we make a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that we do are our talented and motivated professionals, circa 500 of whom are based at our Global Business Solutions centre in Little Island, Cork. There we boast vibrant workforce made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages.. . Established in 2010 to gain efficiencies in areas such as General Accounting, Purchase to Pay and Order to Cash, the GBS Cork quickly excelled in its financial mandate, allowing the Cork leadership to ask, how can we apply these processes to other areas of the business? And so the GBS we have today was born, still leading in finance, but also evolving and expanding into diverse Business Service functions including Customer Meeting Services, Global HR Data Management, Medical Information, TLAC, and more to come on stream across 2020... . This, along with the current physical expansion of the Little Island campus, means there has never been a more exciting time to be part of the GBS story! Mirroring the existing Island House building, the new Island Hall facility will extend our overall capacity to in excess of 1000 employees where Lilly will continue to offer a premium workspace across both buildings, complete with healthcare, pension and life assurance benefits, subsidised canteen, wellbeing facilities, travel subsidies, car-pooling incentives, bike to work scheme, on-site parking and much more.. . At the GBS, it’s not just about what we do today, but how we can continuously improve and innovate for present and future operations. We view the development of our highly skilled workforce in much the same way and want to grow your role into an empowering and fulfilling career here at Lilly. Therefore, with the sole purpose of employee progression, weekly Manager 1:1s, a dedicated Learning & Development service and Educational Assistance schemes all await you.. . Above all, it’s about being part of an open, welcoming and inclusive culture, one that is further enhanced by the dedication of our committees - Culture Club, Diversity & Inclusion, Sports & Social, Corporate Social Responsibility, Health Safety & Environment and Food.. . Within GBS, the Global Transparency (GT) Team is responsible for collecting and reporting global payments and other non cash transfers of value (e.g., business meals, airline tickets, etc.) provided to Health Care Providers (HCPs) and Health Care Organizations (HCOs) by Lilly and external third parties as required to meet various legal (including US Open Payments, US state and International) and global industry trade group requirements (including Europe and Canada) .. . The GT Data Intelligence and Reporting group manage processes from data collection through report generation to ensure the timely, complete and accurate delivery of all required reporting. The primary geographic area of focus for this role will be US/ Europe. Although the focus of this role will be on US/ Europe, this individual will also serve as back-up for other geographies. The person who fills this role will lead data collection and reporting processes, drive resolution of corrections or omissions, and work with HCPs and HCOs to resolve inquiries/disputes in a manner that maximizes customer experience.. . The person who fills this role will be responsible for leading data collection and reporting processes, driving resolution of corrections or omissions, and working with physicians to resolve inquiries/disputes in a manner that maximizes customer experience and meets Lilly’s transparency obligations. As new transparency requirements emerge, this individual will partner with other Lilly teams including GBS Solutions Delivery to build and execute plans to meet those requirements by leveraging Lilly’s global systems and processes.. . Primary Responsibilities. . As a key user of Lilly’s proprietary transparency data processing and report generating software, set up and manage parameters which auto-generate all global transparency data files and reports for internal and external uses.. Interact with various governmental agencies, including US Federal and Various States, to meet Lilly’s legal reporting obligations, including data submission, participating in industry round tables, and other opportunities to influence technical and process requirements and improvements.. Establish annual timelines with milestones for activities needed to meet all external transparency obligations. Lead cross-functional resources in meeting those timelines.. Oversee the collection and loading of transparency data from a variety of sources, partnering with various global and local teams.. Ensure relevant analytics are conducted to provide confidence that the data are complete, accurate, and timely, including coordinating data reviews by subject matter experts in each geography.. Lead or provide consultation for resolution of process or data issues which impact transparency reporting.. Submit transparency data/reports to external agencies, including facilitation of internal approval and attestation processes.. Drive processes to identify and report any corrections or omissions, including root cause analysis and corrective/preventative actions.. Lead the identification and implementation of process improvements.. Lead data quality governance processes.. Work with physicians and other health care providers to resolve inquiries or disputes, ensuring a positive customer experience.. Partner with Global Transparency IT and Solution Delivery team members to understand and prepare Lilly to meet new reporting obligations including driving potential system changes and configuration of Lilly’s proprietary transparency data processing and report generated software.. Understand all relevant data, systems, policies / procedures, and reporting requirements. Build a thorough understanding of Global Transparency reporting requirements. Develop knowledge of systems and business processes to support data analysis and inquiry needs (data collection, processing & reporting).. Develop awareness of various global reporting requirements; understand possible implications to reporting environment and make recommendations for system and business changes. . . Manage efforts to process and analyze transparency data that support report delivery. . Act as GT subject matter expert, lead development of new capabilities and support other team members and business partners. Support the processing and analysis of HCP/ HCO payment data from applicable systems and processes. Manage data inquiries from internal and external customers, and manage issue resolution. Facilitate collection, management, and analysis of data from third parties, as necessary. Develop, document, communicate, and enforce data standards, as necessary. Collaborate and influence business & IT partners to accommodate new & changing reporting requirements. Develop and maintain strong relationships / communication with global cross-functional business process and data owners (business & IT). Partner with IT and business areas to understand data gaps and drive issues to closure; leverage partnerships to influence business process changes, where appropriate. Anticipate and understand impact of changes to sources systems on reporting capabilities, changes to reporting requirements on system needs, etc.. Provide ongoing consulting on data strategy (e.g., control design, operational processes, etc.), including potential impacts of expanding requirements. . . Additional Preferences. . Demonstrated leadership and ability to influence peers, management, and business partners. Understanding of IT, data management, and project management principles.. Experience working with global business partners.. High degree of comfort working with IT partners and in a technical environment. Demonstrated critical thinking; ability to think broadly and strategically.. Knowledge of transparency reporting obligations, and understanding of evolving transparency landscape.. Ability to analyze data in order to draw conclusions.. Experience using Tableau data visualization or other similar software. . . Create, Promote and Maintain Operational Excellence. . Actively work in partnership with various cross-functional stakeholders (internally & externally) to maintain effective relationships and ensuring efficient and compliant processes.. Ensure the culture of compliance is reinforced continuously within the team.. Continuously look for and or lead where possible continuous improvement initiatives including standardization and/or re-engineering of processes and controls.. Drive for results and ensure best practices are in place to achieve highest standards within daily operations.. Drive cross-functional projects where opportunity arises.. Demonstrate excellent project management abilities and strong understanding of financial systems.. Support organizational changes.. A nalyse and translate data into key strategic inputs and insights to drive decision making.. Proven ability to work on high level value-add ad hoc projects while continuing to achieve routine goals. . . Systems. . Experience in MS Office. SAP Experience. . . Qualifications. . Bachelor’s Degree. Travel Percentage – Up to 10% international travel may be required. . . Job Overview. . Location: Flexible - preference US or Ireland. . *Blended working options available. . . . . Due to an internal promotion, the Medical business is seeking to appoint a Product Line Controller for its Devices product line. This is a global role that requires strong analytical competence coupled with a genuine leadership ability. As Controller you will partner with the Devices Product Leader (based in Minneapolis) with responsibility for all aspects of the global product portfolio, including strategic and business planning, pricing, NPI project portfolio management, gaining cross functional alignment and driving execution of the business plan to achieve financial targets. You will be responsible for providing financial and analytical support to recommend investment decisions, portfolio adjustments and to manage operating expenses.. . . . . In this role the Controller will work closely with the Leadership team encompassing CEO, CFO, Project Management, Engineering, S&OP, Commercial and Operations. The successful candidate must be a strong and trusted business partner, achieve results through influence and maintain good working relationships across multiple time zones and cultures. Key to success will be your ability to prioritize actions which generate bottom line impact, distill large volumes of data from multiple sources (both automated and manual), multi-task on different priorities and thrive under pressure. This role reports to the Director of Finance (based in Ireland) and has one direct report, a Senior Analyst (based in Portugal). This role offers innate potential to move upward in the organization and will be supported by internal learning opportunities.. . . . .  Job Responsibilities. . Strong and trusted Finance business partner for the Devices Product Leader and ability to develop strong relationships; delivering business case presentations to Leadership including CEO and CFO on a regular basis. Work with the Devices Product Leader to develop, evaluate and execute long-term strategic financial objectives in line with the overall business strategy including producing 5-year financial strategic plan. Direct and manage the annual budget / quarterly forecast processes for Devices including delivery of detailed plans and identification of key drivers / assumptions and key performance indicators. Deliver consensus forecast from monthly S&OP demand and supply outputs through financial reconciliation; analyse and model backlog, billings and SMI% by customer, product family, region, market, etc.. Drive accountability by keeping Management team informed of actions which need to be executed to achieve financial targets and KPIs . Analyse portfolio to identify price and margin opportunities to improve customer and global product line profitability. Make investment recommendations related to prioritisation of program transfers based on rate of return. Voting member of the Project Advisory Council (PAC); preparation/review of project P&Ls. Preparation of month end financial reporting for the product line. Finance leader for Irish R&D tax credit claim ensuring that all amounts are properly substantiated and able to withstand Revenue audit. Coaching & development across the Global Medical finance team. Drive the continuous development and enhancement of systems, processes and procedures to improve analysis, reporting and decision-support, supporting standardization across the Medical business. Assist with ad hoc strategic (M&A etc.) and operational projects as required. . . . . What your background should look like:. . . . . Qualifications. . Qualified Accountant ACA, ACCA or CIMA, preferably Big 4 trained. Bachelor’s degree . .  . . Key Requirements. . Demonstrate a track record of collaborating with business leaders in a complex multinational business environment. Show evidence of ability to influence and negotiate with key decision makers. Evidence of building & developing a team; encouraging direct conversations, coaching & empowering a team. Extensive and exceptional Excel skills with demonstrated data analytics. Experience with TE data sources preferred (TED2.0, SAP Projects, Hyperion). Able to picture and communicate “simple” solutions to complex business scenarios involving multiple systems and accounting disciplines across multiple regions. Strong communication skills (oral and written) with an ability to articulate complex business issues in a clear/concise manner to multiple levels of stakeholders across multiple geographical locations. Open to change and be able to effectively respond to new information, different or unexpected circumstances, and/or to work in ambiguous situations. Team player with a particularly strong work ethic, positive attitude, humility and a focus on business impact. Highly flexible with a ‘can do’ attitude to execution. Very motivated and able to thrive and think clearly under pressure, in ambiguous situations and with tight deadlines . Detail-oriented, organized, and demonstrated ability to multi-task and shift priorities quickly. Ability to think on your feet and deal with multiple stakeholders . . . . . Core Values: Integrity, Accountability, Teamwork, Innovation. . . . . TE Connectivity is an equal opportunities employer.. . Show more

About Lumen. . Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.. . The Role. . Under minimal supervision, the Lead Marketing Analyst will perform highly complex assignments in support of Mass Markets Business Intelligence (BI) team information processing needs by applying technical competency in information systems tools, techniques, and procedures. Apply system analysis to assist in business needs and provides complex project management or technical business knowledge to develop cost-effective and timely products. Direct project planning, organization, scheduling, implementation, and reporting activities or provide technical expertise to projects while developing competency in complex project management or technical knowledge of major business support areas.. . The Main Responsibilities. . Develop, plan, and manage implementation of activities for highly complex projects/programs for BI Data division.. Accountable for timely project completion and delivery. Analyzes work plans and schedules.. Develops project progress and status reports.. Coordinate and facilitate project meetings. Develop and distribute timely meeting minutes, to include track/manage action items and verify they are incorporated into the program schedule and that deliverables are met on time.. Assess/Manage risk, impacts and potential alternatives and escalate as required to the appropriate level of management.. Set program objectives and establish clear measures to successfully define and meet project deliverables and timelines.. Data Analysis to assist in research and development using SQL. Assist in billing system research related to disputes with Compensation payouts. Familiarity with visual analytics software like QlikSense / Tableau. Work with business partners to define requirements for PAID compensation environment for development team.. Liaison to Business for setting goals, quotas, sales as it relates to Compensation of internal / external partners.. . . What We Look For In a Candidate. . Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education and 6+ years related experience (4+ years with Master’s degree).. Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams such as Sales, Marketing, Billing, IT, Assignment, Programming, Legal, Regulatory, Engineering, Finance, Product, Operations and Support.. Expert experience with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Experience with SQL. Ability to deal with remote client relations through phone, email & online sources in order to enhance the Partner experience.. Ability to quickly understand technical aspects of product/service, both from a functionality perspective but also from an operations/set up perspective and be able to articulate it to a less technical audience.. Strong program/project management skills.. Strong problem solving and analytical skills with ability to identify business needs and make solution recommendations.. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision to plan, organize, and coordinate, multiple project tasks to meet established deadlines and accommodate rapidly changing priorities.. . . At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 35,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.. . At Lilly, we believe in the talent of our workforce. One of the best ways to utilize and develop that talent is to use our existing workforce to fill new and/or open positions. If you are looking for a new position within Lilly, you can view and apply to open roles posted in the internal job posting system. You must meet the minimum qualifications outlined in the job description and have/obtain work authorization in the country the position is located in order to be considered. When applying internally for a position, your current supervisor will receive notification that you have applied to the position. We encourage employees to discuss the opportunity with their supervisor prior to applying.. . Path/Level. . P3. . Note: Employees hired on banded positions (ex: P1-P3, R1-R2, B1-B3, etc.) transfer at their current level, despite the level indicated on the job posting. For example, if a P2 candidate is selected for a P1-P3 banded position, the candidate will remain a P2 in the new role.. . At Lilly, we make a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that we do are our talented and motivated professionals, circa 500 of whom are based at our Global Business Solutions centre in Little Island, Cork. There we boast vibrant workforce made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages.. . Established in 2010 to gain efficiencies in areas such as General Accounting, Purchase to Pay and Order to Cash, the GBS Cork quickly excelled in its financial mandate, allowing the Cork leadership to ask, how can we apply these processes to other areas of the business? And so the GBS we have today was born, still leading in finance, but also evolving and expanding into diverse Business Service functions including Customer Meeting Services, Global HR Data Management, Medical Information, TLAC, and more to come on stream across 2020... . This, along with the current physical expansion of the Little Island campus, means there has never been a more exciting time to be part of the GBS story! Mirroring the existing Island House building, the new Island Hall facility will extend our overall capacity to in excess of 1000 employees where Lilly will continue to offer a premium workspace across both buildings, complete with healthcare, pension and life assurance benefits, subsidised canteen, wellbeing facilities, travel subsidies, car-pooling incentives, bike to work scheme, on-site parking and much more.. . At the GBS, it’s not just about what we do today, but how we can continuously improve and innovate for present and future operations. We view the development of our highly skilled workforce in much the same way and want to grow your role into an empowering and fulfilling career here at Lilly. Therefore, with the sole purpose of employee progression, weekly Manager 1:1s, a dedicated Learning & Development service and Educational Assistance schemes all await you.. . Above all, it’s about being part of an open, welcoming and inclusive culture, one that is further enhanced by the dedication of our committees - Culture Club, Diversity & Inclusion, Sports & Social, Corporate Social Responsibility, Health Safety & Environment and Food.. . Within GBS, the Global Transparency (GT) Team is responsible for collecting and reporting global payments and other non cash transfers of value (e.g., business meals, airline tickets, etc.) provided to Health Care Providers (HCPs) and Health Care Organizations (HCOs) by Lilly and external third parties as required to meet various legal (including US Open Payments, US state and International) and global industry trade group requirements (including Europe and Canada) .. . The GT Data Intelligence and Reporting group manage processes from data collection through report generation to ensure the timely, complete and accurate delivery of all required reporting. The primary geographic area of focus for this role will be US/ Europe. Although the focus of this role will be on US/ Europe, this individual will also serve as back-up for other geographies. The person who fills this role will lead data collection and reporting processes, drive resolution of corrections or omissions, and work with HCPs and HCOs to resolve inquiries/disputes in a manner that maximizes customer experience.. . The person who fills this role will be responsible for leading data collection and reporting processes, driving resolution of corrections or omissions, and working with physicians to resolve inquiries/disputes in a manner that maximizes customer experience and meets Lilly’s transparency obligations. As new transparency requirements emerge, this individual will partner with other Lilly teams including GBS Solutions Delivery to build and execute plans to meet those requirements by leveraging Lilly’s global systems and processes.. . Primary Responsibilities. . As a key user of Lilly’s proprietary transparency data processing and report generating software, set up and manage parameters which auto-generate all global transparency data files and reports for internal and external uses.. Interact with various governmental agencies, including US Federal and Various States, to meet Lilly’s legal reporting obligations, including data submission, participating in industry round tables, and other opportunities to influence technical and process requirements and improvements.. Establish annual timelines with milestones for activities needed to meet all external transparency obligations. Lead cross-functional resources in meeting those timelines.. Oversee the collection and loading of transparency data from a variety of sources, partnering with various global and local teams.. Ensure relevant analytics are conducted to provide confidence that the data are complete, accurate, and timely, including coordinating data reviews by subject matter experts in each geography.. Lead or provide consultation for resolution of process or data issues which impact transparency reporting.. Submit transparency data/reports to external agencies, including facilitation of internal approval and attestation processes.. Drive processes to identify and report any corrections or omissions, including root cause analysis and corrective/preventative actions.. Lead the identification and implementation of process improvements.. Lead data quality governance processes.. Work with physicians and other health care providers to resolve inquiries or disputes, ensuring a positive customer experience.. Partner with Global Transparency IT and Solution Delivery team members to understand and prepare Lilly to meet new reporting obligations including driving potential system changes and configuration of Lilly’s proprietary transparency data processing and report generated software.. Understand all relevant data, systems, policies / procedures, and reporting requirements. Build a thorough understanding of Global Transparency reporting requirements. Develop knowledge of systems and business processes to support data analysis and inquiry needs (data collection, processing & reporting).. Develop awareness of various global reporting requirements; understand possible implications to reporting environment and make recommendations for system and business changes. . . Manage efforts to process and analyze transparency data that support report delivery. . Act as GT subject matter expert, lead development of new capabilities and support other team members and business partners. Support the processing and analysis of HCP/ HCO payment data from applicable systems and processes. Manage data inquiries from internal and external customers, and manage issue resolution. Facilitate collection, management, and analysis of data from third parties, as necessary. Develop, document, communicate, and enforce data standards, as necessary. Collaborate and influence business & IT partners to accommodate new & changing reporting requirements. Develop and maintain strong relationships / communication with global cross-functional business process and data owners (business & IT). Partner with IT and business areas to understand data gaps and drive issues to closure; leverage partnerships to influence business process changes, where appropriate. Anticipate and understand impact of changes to sources systems on reporting capabilities, changes to reporting requirements on system needs, etc.. Provide ongoing consulting on data strategy (e.g., control design, operational processes, etc.), including potential impacts of expanding requirements. . . Additional Preferences. . Demonstrated leadership and ability to influence peers, management, and business partners. Understanding of IT, data management, and project management principles.. Experience working with global business partners.. High degree of comfort working with IT partners and in a technical environment. Demonstrated critical thinking; ability to think broadly and strategically.. Knowledge of transparency reporting obligations, and understanding of evolving transparency landscape.. Ability to analyze data in order to draw conclusions.. Experience using Tableau data visualization or other similar software. . . Create, Promote and Maintain Operational Excellence. . Actively work in partnership with various cross-functional stakeholders (internally & externally) to maintain effective relationships and ensuring efficient and compliant processes.. Ensure the culture of compliance is reinforced continuously within the team.. Continuously look for and or lead where possible continuous improvement initiatives including standardization and/or re-engineering of processes and controls.. Drive for results and ensure best practices are in place to achieve highest standards within daily operations.. Drive cross-functional projects where opportunity arises.. Demonstrate excellent project management abilities and strong understanding of financial systems.. Support organizational changes.. A nalyse and translate data into key strategic inputs and insights to drive decision making.. Proven ability to work on high level value-add ad hoc projects while continuing to achieve routine goals. . . Systems. . Experience in MS Office. SAP Experience. . . Qualifications. . Bachelor’s Degree. Travel Percentage – Up to 10% international travel may be required. . . Ding is the world’s leading universal top-up service. Founded in 2006, Ding was born from seeing something that wasn’t there. 6 billion of the world’s mobile phones are prepaid and a quarter of those are out of top-up. We believe mobile phones can change lives and we want to improve people’s lives by helping those with less gain access to more.. . Our mission is to build and run the safest, simplest most effective and convenient top-up technology, in partnership with the best operators and platforms. We’ll continue to spread joy across the globe helping people everywhere to send little bytes of happiness to their loved ones, keeping our customers connected to their families and friends. Now more than ever we realise the importance of keeping in touch and here at Ding we believe a little goes a long way.. . As Performance Marketing Data Analyst you will own the analytics of digital marketing channels and deliver actionable insight to improve performance and drive commercial decision making. Using web analytics data, you will drive change by providing analysis, insights and recommendations. This job is a brilliant opportunity to join a close-knit team who are incredibly passionate about taking performance marketing to the next level. If you’re looking to come into a new role and make a real impact, then this will be perfect for you!. . Key Responsibilities. . Responsible for the end-to-end management of performance marketing channels analysis (e.g. SEM, SEO, Affiliates, Display, Email) including strategy, tagging set-up, analysis and optimisations. Provide the necessary analysis, insight and recommendations to drive business projects. Help drive the performance marketing strategy to drive profitable hypergrowth through data. Use performance marketing data to help build out Ding’s MTA model. Understand and be able to analyse performance marketing channels and the behaviour they have on each device to create data driven recommendations. Maximize campaigns by providing analysis on the performance of all marketing activity. Interpret and act-upon complex marketing data to create reports conveying meaningful and useful commercial information, making recommendations through both written and verbal reports/presentation. Manage all marketing tagging and pixel requirements. Work cross-functionally to create smoke tests to ensure when data looks off, we can send an alert. Handle all marketing analytical queries from both the digital team and wider business stakeholders, turning them into meaningful stories with recommendations. . . Key Attributes. . Experienced; with thorough, demonstrable knowledge of marketing analytics tools. Commercially minded with experience in interpreting data into meaningful information. A good understanding of commercial decision making and sales driving, as well as a working knowledge of sales and margin reporting process and data management tools. Highly organised with the ability to multi-task and prioritise, working quickly and efficiently to tight deadlines. Collaborative; able to work as part of a team in a constructive and flexible way. A great communicator. You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to interact with all levels of end users and technical resources. As well as the ability to present structured arguments in resolution of problems in a highly creative environment. Highly knowledgeable, with both a broad understanding and experience of all Performance Marketing channels, SEM, Affiliates, SEO, Display and Paid Social. Experienced in strategic marketing and consumer facing ecommerce with a background in marketing analytics. You are able to consider analytics from a real customer perspective.. Advanced in data manipulation skills using Excel and similar tools, as well as experienced in writing tag specs and managing implementation processes. Experience in marketing measurement for native apps as well as experience in combining offline sources (e.g. profit margin) into Digital analytics tools / analysis would be beneficial. Strong SQL skills. Applied statistics skills such as distributions, statistical testing, regression etc.. Ability to harvest insights from data with proficiency in R/Python. . . About Ding. . Ding was founded to change billions of lives by accelerating mobile access.. . As the number one international mobile top-up platform in the world, Ding has been keeping people connected since 2006, when it launched this first-of-a-kind service. Today, Ding’s users have successfully sent over 400 million top-ups globally, via the app, online at Ding.com, and in-store at over 600,000+ retail outlets worldwide. In fact, Ding delivers a top-up every second, via 500+ operators, across 140+ countries – helping families and friends around the world to stay connected.. . Ding is headquartered in Dublin, Ireland, and also has offices in Barcelona, Bucharest, Dhaka, Dubai, New Jersey and Paris. Ding’s culturally diverse team of more than 200 people reflects our commitment to delivering cutting-edge, potentially life-changing technology to developed and emerging markets alike.. . We're always on the lookout for talented people who embody our core values:. . We are Customer Curious. We are Thinkers, Linkers & Doers. We Work Better Together. We Seek Out that Spark. . . Ding recruitment privacy notice is available at https://www.ding.com/recruitment-privacy-notice. . Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs. Role: Data Analyst, Data Engineering Team. .  . . Location: Our teams are currently working remotely and we expect this to continue for some time in light of the present circumstances. Post pandemic, we will have a hybrid approach to working, which will include a blend of onsite and remote working. .  . . This role is offered on a permanent basis. .  . . Data and Analytics in AIB. . AIB is a dynamic, diverse and fun place to work. We are changing from the inside out to become a bank people can believe in. And by people, we mean our employees as well as our customers. We back our customers and employees’ dreams and ambitions!. . . . . We are investing in the future with a heavy focus on expanding the Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence – so it’s a great time to join and help shape and grow this function, as we become a data driven bank with best in class analytical capabilities. Within Data & Analytics you’ll experience a diverse workforce where everyone has the opportunity to reach their potential. We work in an agile environment that empowers its people, where your voice is heard and where you’ll be invested in to learn and grow along the way.. .  . . Summary of the Role. . The Data Engineering team forms part of the Data Engineering and Architecture area within the Centre of Excellence for Data and Analytics at AIB.. . This is an exciting and challenging opportunity for the successful candidate to expand the team’s ability to deliver data products in a best in class infrastructure where data and analytical tooling integrate deeply.. .  . . We’re looking for someone who/can:. . Interprets complex data analysis requirements and help identify the most appropriate solutions. Work with stakeholders internally across the organisation and present back analytical findings. Follow processes to make decisions on query approach and visualisation outputs, taking guidance for more complex problems. Escalates any identified issues and opportunities as appropriate.. Will establish strong relationships with business partners and key stakeholders across the organisation to understand their requirements. Support a continuous improvement culture within the organisation. Support an environment where creative thinking is encouraged and developed. Champions a Customer First culture in support of our Purpose, strategic ambition and Brand Values, by ensuring processes and procedures consistently promote good outcomes for all our customers.. .  . . You will need to show us that you can/have:. . 3+ years data analyst experience within financial services organisations. Highly numerate and passionate about data and analytics. Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with a strong knowledge of SQL. Self-starter with ability to work on own initiative and strong attention to detail, completing tasks to a very high degree of accuracy.. Proven ability to quickly adapt to new environments and to gain an understanding of new processes, applications and procedures. Knowledge of the data quality challenges and impacts financial services organisations face and of solutions to sustainably address these. Experience in data modelling and visualisation tools is an advantage. .  . . As part of the interview process you will be expected to demonstrate the capabilities reflected below.. .  . . Data Analysis: Collects, analyses and interprets data to reach conclusions and/or present insights and findings.. Collaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.. Requirement Analysis: Works with clients to understand their issues and recommend solutions.. Streamline & Simplify:​​​​​ Knowing the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement.. Technical Communication / Presentation: Communicates with clarity and precision, presenting complex information in a concise format that is audience appropriate.. .  . . Why join us?. . AIB is a dynamic and diverse place to work. We are changing from the inside out to become a bank people can believe in. And by people, we mean our employees as well as our customers.. . In each team you’ll find leaders who focus as much on people as they do on function. Here, anyone who is responsible for managing people is called a people leader, not a manager. That shows our commitment and focus on the development and engagement of the people who work here.. . . . . We call our Diversity & Inclusion plan iMatter – because that is our aim. No matter who we are, where we are from, how we look, we all make a difference. You’ll find a mix of age, race and gender, where everyone has an opportunity to reach their potential. You’ll find a culture of openness, positivity and respect where everyone has a voice.. .  . . If you feel you have what it takes, Click Apply and fill in the online application form. If you would like more information Donal O’Sullivan from the Talent Acquisition Team can help. You can contact him by email at careers@aib.ie. .  . . By when? Closing date is Thursday 29th April 2021. . Show more

Because you belong at Twilio. . The Who, What, Why And Where. . Twilio is growing rapidly and seeking a Staff Financial Analyst - P2P Lead to join our Financial systems enablement team supporting the Finance & Accounting teams. The ideal candidate should be a self starter, have a solid analytical mentality, good interpersonal communications and diligent time management skills, be a team-player and have a good work ethic. Lastly you work well under pressure to meet ongoing and overlapping deadlines within short time constraints.. . This role is expected to be an Oracle ERP cloudSME/Lead in P2P processes working with different types of SaaS enterprise P2P systems in partnership with the Global Accounting and procurement teams driving automations and Innovation. You will lead the entire P2P process in Oracle ERP Fusion system implementation end - end understanding Twilio’s processes and systems and build scalable systems for Acquisitions.. . Who?. . Twilio is looking for a Staff Financial Analyst - P2P Lead who lives in Twilio Magic. They also have:. . Industry leader generating deep techno functional detail in P2P and other processes including vendor management, self service procurement, sourcing, contract management Invoice processing/OCR, GL, Cash management, tax, engaged in architecture decisions on the team.. 8+ years of Accounting experience and in depth understanding of P2P processes in Oracle ERP cloud with experience in a global, SaaS, technology company preferred.. Partner with process owners to define and benchmark operational metrics and to automate the delivery of metric dashboards.. Architect, design, document, configure, deliver and automate in areas of P2P in various applications like simple legal, Lease calcs and other integrated finance applications.. Proficient in process and solution engineering, managing and delivering multi-functional l multiple projects and integrations with advanced presentation skills and authoritative communications.. Architect and design multi-functional requirement sessions to elicit, document and analyze business requirements and functional specifications. Includes identifying unspoken or conflicting requirements and challenging the norm.. Experience with multiple acquisitions combining various P2P systems into a common platform is a plus.. Experience with the following systems is a plus; Gappify, Simple legal, Lease calcs, Coupa, Expensify, Avalara/other tax software, Data Warehouse, ERP(NetSuite), Anaplan, Tableau, Looker, ServiceNow, Workday, Salesforce.com, OKTA, GSuite.. Experience working in a high scale and fast-paced environment with distributed teams across time zones.. . What?. . As a Staff Financial Analyst - P2P Lead for the Financial Enablement teams, you will. . BE AN OWNER: You own the process of driving the organization to best practises using strong Functional and Influential skills communicating to senior leaders and communicating with partners across the organization.. WEAR THE CUSTOMER’S SHOES: Proactively identify and clearly communicate messages and updates regarding blockers, dependencies, risks, and current status to all partners. RUTHLESSLY PRIORITIZE: Demonstrate strong prioritization and focus skills with multitasking and competing priorities and know how to make the right trade-offs.. BE INCLUSIVE: Liaise well with IT teams and various business partners upstream/downstream to influence accuracy and efficiency in the revenue accounting process.. DRAW THE OWL: Find opportunities for operational improvements across Finance & Accounting business applications and drive solution definition using metrics.. WRITE IT DOWN: Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication with advanced presentation skills..Ensure that complex ideas, thoughts, and vision can be communicated simply and effectively. You are expected to thrive in a highly collaborative environment.. EMPOWER OTHERS - Mentor your team, develop their talent and challenge the status quo to achieve results.. . Why?. . The Twilio IT organization is on a mission to hire the very best employees and to create exceptional employee experiences. We are actively scaling for current and future growth and believe that we can add value to Twilio through our collaboration with the various functional teams. Cohesity radically simplifies data management. We make it easy to back up, manage, and derive value from data -- across the data center, edge and cloud. Cohesity also helps ensure data is in compliance and protected against ransomware attacks. We offer a full suite of data management services consolidated on one multicloud data platform, reducing complexity and eliminating mass data fragmentation. Cohesity can be delivered as a service, self-managed, or provided by a Cohesity-powered partner.. . We’ve been named a Leader by multiple analyst firms, and are prominently featured in the Forbes Cloud 100 and CRN’s Coolest Cloud companies. Our growth is off the charts, and we’re just getting started!. . Deployment Architect. . Want to translate what our sales teams sell into a deployable architecture? We are looking for experienced architects who can develop the detailed blueprint for a successful customer deployment. Additionally, you’ll create repeatable blueprints that become the templates for all customer deployments. These will be used to develop our services practices, to enable our delivery teams, our partner teams and our customers to deploy our secondary storage solutions applications. The ideal candidate is someone who has considerable experience architecting, documenting, deploying and enabling others.. . These practices will utilize the architecture sold by our account teams to achieve customer committed solutions. In addition to building these solutions, this role will also spend considerable time validating these procedures in the field and teaching partners and customers how to apply these in their environment.. . Responsibilities. . You will be working with engineering, systems engineers, tech marketing specialists, and customer support build to build out professional services practices starting with the architectural blueprint that covers installation, integration, applications, migration, scripting (automation) to be used by delivery teams, partners and customers. Deliver architectures and professional services to Cohesity customers. Build strategic relationships with key customers and Cohesity teams. Write and validate deployment architectures. Define technical architecture including sizing and performance that meet customer requirements. Engage with teams to ensure blueprint is successfully deployed. Create knowledge-base articles related to the practices and architectures. Develop best practices for the blueprints that translate to project plans. Continually improve deliverables as we scale and release new features/products. Inspect deliverables for successes and improvements. Work with others to develop post deployment documentation (run books, pre-deployment templates, etc). Convert blueprints and best practices into a training curriculum. Deliver hands-on training in small-group formats. Participate in delivery of blueprints. Conduct beta testing of procedures for new deployment blueprints in the field. Provide feedback to consultants, Systems Engineers, and engineering on ways to improve overall experience. Act as Principal for key / high-profile implementations. . . Qualifications. . Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. Minimum 6 years experience in IT. Experience in these technical areas required. Linux, Backup and Virtualization (VMware, HyperV, Citrix Xen App/Desktop). Oracle, SQL, Data Migration. Additional experience highly desirable:. Storage. Disaster Recovery/Business Continuance. Database Protection and Recovery. Public Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP). Layer 2 Networking and Firewalls. Scripting / Automation. Visio or equivalent application. MySQL/Hadoop. SAP. Excellent communication and project-related skills are also required. Strong verbal communication/presentation skills. Strong written skills and the ability to create documentation. The ability to teach others and make them successful. Self-starter with excellent organization and time management skills. The ability to manage projects and to drive to a deadline. . . Data Privacy Notice For Job Candidates. . Data Engineer, Ad Platforms. . Job Description. . A Little About Us. . Verizon Media brands comprise some of the premier destinations on the Internet -- Yahoo, Techcrunch, AOL, and more. This means that we rely on massively scalable, widely distributed, highly performant systems. If you want to help solve complex problems for systems like these, we are looking for you.. . Verizon Media's Business Analytics and Insights team works on one of the biggest online advertising and audience data sets in the world. We are responsible for providing fast, clean, and relevant data for Verizon Media’s advertising businesses as well as key measurements and insights about the users of Verizon Media. We are developing next generation technologies to enrich our advertiser and user experience through complex, scalable data platforms, with ever growing and interesting challenges.. . The team is seeking a Data Engineer/Analyst to support Verizon Media Ad Platforms by building and maintaining data pipelines, reporting, and dashboards, as well as conducting ad hoc analyses to understand complex marketplace trends.. . A Lot About You. . Values : You have a strong work ethic and strong core values (honesty, integrity, objectivity). Curiosity & Problem-Solving : You are always curious, you love data, and you love exploring new datasets to enrich your understanding. . Quantitative Approach : You're able to focus on the numbers and take an objective view of a complex and dynamic business. . Dealing with Ambiguity : Ability to take poorly defined problems and provide solutions that address the spirit of the question (without needing all the details). . Agility & Speed :Thrives in fast-paced environments and can iterate quickly.. . Communication : You're good at explaining and illustrating complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences. . Organization : Ability to juggle multiple projects, with a strong habit of communicating early and often. . Self-Starter : You have a willingness to roll up your sleeves to get things done. You’re always thinking about ways to improve and not afraid of pursuing new ideas. . Teamwork : You make those around you better and enjoy working collaboratively. You are always thinking of how your work can impact the broader organization. . . Responsibilities. . Understand the Business and Data : Support Business subject matter experts to discover insights into advertiser, publisher, product, user, and auction dynamics. Understand the underlying data systems and schemas that can inform these measurements.. Analysis & Dashboarding : Conduct ad hoc investigations and create ongoing dashboards and reports that provide analysis and commentary, explaining business trends and market drivers using intuitive visualizations (Looker, Tableau, R, Spreadsheets, etc). . Data Engineering : Develop data pipelines (ETL) from multiple data sources with design, performance, and end customer in mind (Pig, Hive, Oozie, Python, SQL, PLSQL, etc). Partner with engineering teams across data sources to address technical and functional requirements.. . Investigation & Troubleshooting : Expert at “cracking” complex business and analytical problems. In particular, experience in working with large data sets, identifying and troubleshooting data discrepancies via automated scripts, developing data models/schemas, and working cross-functionally towards resolution.. . Data Governance : Streamline data & tools footprint in alignment with Data Governance objectives.. . . Qualifications. . BS/MS in quantitative field or equivalent experience. 5+ years of experience in analytics, data engineering, and dashboarding. . Experience working with large and complex data sets. . Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc). . Strong database skills (e.g. MySQL, Oracle) and familiarity with spreadsheets (Excel, Google Sheets, Pivot Tables, Formulas). . Experience with programming languages such as Perl/Python/R/Java is preferred. . Experience with the Hadoop ecosystem is preferred, but not required (Pig, Hive, Presto, Oozie). . Experience in the online advertising industry preferred, but not required. . Demonstrated use of analytics, metrics, and benchmarking to drive decisions. . . Show more

The GBS Lilly Management Team is currently looking for a people-oriented, customer centric and forward-thinking Local Data Analyst Manager, to join its new team in Cork. This individual will be an exceptional professional, who consistently exceeds expectations, thrives in a challenging and dynamic work environment, and will be an active contributor to our team. The Local Data Analyst Manager, will work cross-functionally and have regular interaction with key business partners.. . Lilly enjoys a strong reputation for quality and focus on employee development. We make it our mission to attract the best and we always look at alternative ways to provide opportunities for our people to excel, grow and build a great career. Other than working with a great team, we also offer a very competitive benefits package, we provide an open and friendly work environment where we empower people and provide them with opportunities to develop their long-term career.. . Roles and Responsibilities include Recognize, exemplify and adhere to the Lilly values which center on our commitment to People, Excellence and Compliance. As a key member of staff, the Manager is expected to embrace and contribute to our culture of continuous improvement with a focus on streamlining our processes adding value to our business and meeting customer/stakeholder needs.. . Key Responsibilities. . People. . Be able to take charge of, inspire and influence a team of 6-12 employees. Demonstrated ability to lead a small organization toward a common vision. Actively connect with your people and champion employee engagement. Develop top talent by participating in regular succession planning and having robust performance /coaching conversations.. Work as part of the GBS management team to make the GBS a great place to work for all employees.. . Create, Promote and Maintain Operational Excellence. . Actively work in partnership with various cross-functional stakeholders (internally & externally) to maintain effective relationships and ensuring efficient and compliant processes.. Ensure the culture of compliance is reinforced continuously within the team.. Continuously look for and or lead where possible continuous improvement initiatives including standardization and/or re-engineering of processes and controls.. Drive for results and ensure best practices are in place to achieve highest standards within daily operations.. Drive cross-functional projects where opportunity arises.. Demonstrate excellent project management abilities and strong understanding of master data.. Support organizational changes.. Analyse and translate data into key strategic inputs and insights to drive decision making.. Proven ability to work on high level value-add ad hoc projects while continuing to achieve routine goals. . . Basic Requirements. . Fluent in English. Strong People Management & Leadership Skills. Self-motivated professional with excellent customer service and strong working/team building relationship skills. Proven interpersonal and communication skills to interact with all levels of an organization. Demonstrates good judgment and is solution orientated. Ability to set and drive priorities for the team independently. Strong organizational and multitasking capabilities. Attentive to details to ensure compliance and accurate reporting. Experience of working to tight deadlines. Flexibility in adapting to a non-routine and fast paced environment. Strong communication skills. . . Education Requirements. . Bachelor’s degree. . . Additional Preferences. . Systems Experience especially SAP is a plus. Experience with Clinical Trial Materials supply chain. Understanding of master data governance and roles. . At Deloitte, we deliver the solutions and insights our clients need to address their most complex business challenges. As the world’s largest global professional services and consulting network, Deloitte Ireland has nearly 3,000 people providing audit, tax, consulting, and corporate finance services to public and private clients spanning multiple industries.. . Deloitte’s Consulting Practice is one of the world's leading Management Consulting firms for executable Strategy, Operations, Technology, and Human Capital Advisory services. The consulting practice is built around integrated core capabilities - people, process, technology and industry expertise - the capabilities needed to help clients to tackle their most complex challenges .. . What impact will you make?. . Deloitte has exciting career opportunities for Consultants/Senior Consultants within our Analytics & Information Management Team. These are roles within our analytics team who help clients realise value from the business data in their IT systems. Using the latest technologies you will be continually encouraged to devise innovative solutions to help our clients deliver high quality business intelligence from their technology platform. You will develop your technical and business skill set across industry sectors. You will work on diverse and varied projects with our clients to transform or develop their technology strategy. We offer the opportunity to work with a variety of clients across a number of different sectors. We provide a challenging and exciting work environment with scope for personal development and on-going training.. . About The Team. . Our analytics team are data enthusiasts, eager to explore and discover hidden insights within data that can provide real value to our clients. Businesses today gather an ever increasing wealth of structured and unstructured data from a myriad of sources but often are not extracting the full value from this information.. . Our team build tools, create interactive visualisations, search for patterns and develop predictive models in order to bring actionable insight from the data. Complementing these abilities with deep industry knowledge across the Deloitte network along with technical integration skills and business transformation capabilities provides a complete offering to our clients, allowing value to be realised from data driven insights. As businesses realise the potential value of their data, analytics specialists with skills in data management, visualisation and insight generation will be in high demand.. . Principal Duties and Responsibilities:. . . Supporting client engagement work in a variety of industries, areas and specialisms. Assisting in the scoping and delivery of analytical projects. Envisioning and leading the design and delivery innovative solutions using latest open source and proprietary technologies to meet client needs. Exploiting industry best practices and your experience to create business solutions for our clients. . Skills, Experience and Qualifications:. . . A minimum of a third level degree in Maths, Physics, Engineering, Computer Sciences or a related discipline. Commercial experience in an information management role. Experience in handling large and complex datasets using statistical programming languages (R, Matlab, Python, SAS etc.) is essential. Basic knowledge of or exposure to machine learning, data visualisation, and artificial intelligence techniques (clustering, regression, classification, etc.). Experience with R, Python, SQL, matlab, alteryx, SPSS, SAS, VBA or other languages. 3 years post qualification experience.. Excellent numerical aptitude, with evidence of applied problem solving. Experience in applying machine learning / data mining techniques. Ability to deliver comprehensive and detailed analytical reports. Clear and articulate communication style. Ability to collaborate and share initiatives in developing market leading, innovative analytics. As this role may require international travel proof of EEA work entitlements will be required. . . At its core, Stripe is a treasury company. We are seeking a Treasury Financial Risk Business Analyst to help us fulfill our mission of building the Global Payments and Treasury Network (GPTN), enabling our users to move money to and from their own user constituents and to understand and optimize these flows. Treasury is inextricably intertwined with our product suite; in order to continue to build novel and powerful products for our users, our own treasury capabilities must be excellent.. To that end, Stripe is building a world class Treasury team focused on being fully automated and supremely lean. We work closely with Data Science, Treasury Engineering and Payments Infrastructure engineering teams to build great systems. We also work closely with product and finance teams to shape our understanding of how Stripe is performing as a business and what our best opportunities are for continued growth. We are looking for someone fantastic to join our fast growing team and to help us build integrated financial systems and processes, working alongside our business partners and our world-class engineers.. . Collaborate with business stakeholders to translate business needs/ questions into functional requirements. Liaise with Accounting, Engineering, and other internal teams to ensure stakeholder alignment and appropriate controls. Partner with Engineering on the design of intraday risk engine capability in the GPTN - including the development of proprietary systems focused on observability as well as controls and alerting. Develop financial risk operating metrics in partnership with Data Science to provide regional observability into KRIs and KPIs.. Build dashboards and custom reports to track key metrics, empower other team members with data, and investigate business questions. Conduct deep dive analysis addressing key business questions and presenting them to stakeholders. Develop workflow processes and implement Treasury policies, procedures, and controls. Ensure regulatory compliance in our processes. . . . Our Ideal Candidate Will Have. . 6+ years of finance experience. The ability to work with and synthesize extremely large data sets and previous systems design / project management / business analyst experience. An inclination to solve problems systematically via infrastructure and automation. A clear willingness to “roll up their sleeves” and dive into the details. The ability to work independently or with a small team. Flexibility with changing requirements in an evolving and fast-paced environment. Strong communication skills and an ability to build and leverage cross-functional relationships. A demonstrated ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with a high attention to detail. . . . Nice To Haves. . Knowledge of payments industry. Experience with SQL, Oracle, Risk Management and Trading Systems. . . . To Apply, Please Include. . A resume and LinkedIn profile.. . .
