Business Analyst, Talent Insights and People Analytics. . Amazon’s Product Assurance, Risk, and Security organization (PARS) is looking for a forward-thinking Business Analyst to help build out our People Analytics and Talent Insights function.. . The Business Analyst will be responsible for managing all data and research initiatives to assess the impact of our onboarding and cross-training programs within our Compliance Operations department, surfacing insights that help these programs continuously improve.. . The analyst works independently, owning the end-to-end process of researching and analyzing impact and performance of training. They will be customer focused, collaborating with multiple business partners to extract from, and work with, diverse data sources to translate complex or ambiguous problems.. . To be successful, the Business Analyst must dive deep into metrics and demonstrate a high-level of curiosity to overcome multifaceted analytical problems. They must also possess fundamental soft skills to earn the trust of their business partners to ensure access to sensitive data sources, forge collaborative partnerships to root-cause problems, identify solutions, and provide recommendations. They must be able to communicate complex concepts and present information to different levels of the organization.. . The Business Analyst will seek to develop full-scale automated solutions that enable stakeholders to self-service access and independently query their workforce data.. . Having advanced technical acumen in research, statistics, and data analytics methodologies is preferred. Proficiency in using software such as Tableau, QuickSight, Excel-Power Query, Power Pivot, and Power BI will be highly advantageous for this role. Knowledge of programming languages such as SQL, Python, and R is required.. . This position can be based at Amazon locations throughout Europe with a preference for Luxembourg or The United Kingdom.. . Specific Expectations. . Inspector. . . Inspects the adoption of our training mechanisms and their output to tell a clear story about program efficacy and effectiveness. Assists stakeholders in determining what is happening, why, and what should be done when program performance is deficient. Builder. . . Establishes processes and protocols for gathering and analyzing data as a founding member of the People Analytics and Talent Insights team. Provides data that contributes to the Talent Development vision for the organization. Uses advanced technical acumen to design automated and self-service data access points/dashboards; creating solutions that go beyond traditional approaches. Thought Partner. . . Leads without authority to assist peers, leaders, and stakeholders in making data-driven decisions. Engages in a consultative way to proactively define impact and performance of learning. Develops and implements strategies to appropriately measure impact and performance of learning including credible business impact and return on investment. The Client Regulatory Reporting team is part of the Data Management & Reporting group within Business Support & Operations in Amundi Ireland. The purpose of the team is to support the regulatory reporting requirements of Amundi’s clients and distributors, covering regulations such as PRIIPs, MiFID II and Solvency II.. . . . . The Client Regulatory Reporting Analyst will be dedicated during 2021 to Amundi’s internal project to implement an industrial and automated solution for producing PRIIPs Key Information Documents (KIDs) in order to meet a regulatory deadline. The focus of the individual within the project will be on the data requirements of the KIDs and the data processes that support the target operating model for the production of PRIIPs KIDs.. . . . . At the end of the project, the individual will be expected to manage the transition of the data support for PRIIPs KIDs from project activity to a business as usual mode within the Client Regulatory Reporting team and they themselves will revert to a regular operational role within the team, supporting all client regulatory reporting, not just PRIIPs KIDs.. . . . . The role will require the individual to develop a strong understanding of the content and data components of the PRIIPs KIDs, to build up an intimate knowledge of the internal systems and external service providers who supply the necessary data and to carry out hands-on inspection and analysis of that data. During their role in the project, the individual will deal with IT, business and project management contributors as well as colleagues within the Client Regulatory Reporting team and wider Data Management & Reporting group.. .  . . . . . Duties & Responsibilities. . Contribute to planning of project deliverables, strive to meet project deadlines and provide regular updates to the project organisation. Provide hands-on inspection and analysis of data within client regulatory reports / documents and in source systems and to troubleshoot issues that arise. Liaise with other departments in Amundi who act as data owners and product owners to ensure that data requirements are fulfilled and that the end reporting meets the requirements of Amundi’s clients. Liaise with the IT department regarding the development and enhancement of client regulatory reporting solutions. Create and run reports in accordance with required frequencies and deadlines to meet the regulatory requirements of clients. Work with external providers to whom Amundi has outsourced the production and dissemination of certain client regulatory reports. Record and track new client regulatory reporting requirements that are raised by the Client Services teams and take the necessary actions to support those requirements. .  . . . . . Experience and Qualifications. . Bachelor’s degree or higher. Minimum 5 years experience in the Asset Management Industry, in Reporting, Data Management or Business Analysis roles. Previous experience of PRIIPs, MiFID II EMT and/or Solvency II TPT regulatory reporting would be an advantage. .  . .  . . . . . Competencies. . Motivated self-starter and committed team player. Strong organisational abilities, with a proven ability to meet deadlines. Effective analytical and problem solving skills, as well as attention to detail. Good knowledge of asset management data (e.g. fund characteristics, NAV data, performance data, holdings data, security data). Customer service and results orientated. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Competent technical skills, particularly MS Excel. Show more

Risk Analyst. . Zurich Treasury Services (ZTS) is looking for a Risk Analyst to join the Middle Office team. The Middle Office team are responsible for the valuation of the Groups derivative portfolio, monitoring market, credit and liquidity risk, provision of market data to other Group entities, Model Validation, static data set-up and maintenance and for the provision of Group regulatory reporting requirements pertaining to derivative and treasury transactions. The team is committed to ongoing efficiency improvement and development of optimal Treasury processes while ensuring strong internal controls and maintaining excellent relationships with internal teams and Group functions.. . As a Risk Analyst your main responsibilities will include, but not necessarily be limited to, the following:. . . Responsible for accurate and timely delivery of all daily cash management, P&L Attribution, and risk limit monitoring & reporting (including Credit Risk and Liquidity Risk).. Validate MTM results through in-house analytics, counterparty reconciliations and use of independent alternative derivative valuation solutions.. Monitoring daily market rate feeds into Group treasury system.. Support derivative model validation activities.. Production of VaR calculations for the Group derivative portfolio, and measure/quantify impact of risk exposure for proposed trades by Group Investment Management.. Perform scenario analysis on the Groups Derivative Portfolio.. Support other teams in investigating and explaining MTM movements.. Support in the delivery of regulatory reporting for Treasury and derivative products.. Provide support to Middle Office management across all group projects (including project management, project planning and project implementation).. Set-up and reconciliation of static data in the Treasury System. Act as point of contact and derivative expert for other areas within the Group.. Work with Front Office to investigate queries within various portfolios. Monitoring, reviewing and investigating all trade amendments and cancellations to ensure they are recorded accurately in the system and setting up of new portfolios and counterparties within the trading system, where necessary.. . . Skills & Experience. . As a Risk Analyst your skills and qualifications will include:. . . 2+ years Treasury Risk / Financial Markets experience preferred. Experience with derivative valuation systems for pricing and modeling. Experience in producing daily risk reports, and documenting procedures. Experience in demonstrating successful cross-functional engagement. Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with derivative pricing capability. Experience of using Bloomberg, Reuters and Findur Openlink (Treasury and Capital Markets system) an advantage but not essential. Strong risk analysis skills, and experience using analytical applications e.g. Excel, Power BI. Good knowledge of and understanding of programming languages such as VBA and SQL. Good appreciation of data and data modelling. . . Qualifications. . . Strong academic background, with a minimum 3rd Level degree in Finance, Economics or related quantitative discipline.. . . Who You Are. . . Strong interest in and knowledge of financial markets. In depth knowledge of financial products and valuation including FX, Money Market and Derivatives. Understanding of liquidity, interest rate and credit risk. Knowledge of working with a Treasury Management System e.g. Openlink, Calypso, Murex and Bloomberg advantage but not essential. Advanced written and spoken English. Good interpersonal and communication skills. Extremely high attention to detail and well organized. High motivation, willingness to take initiative and responsibility. A ‘can do’ approach. Highlights areas where processes can be improved and proposes solutions.. . . Change your job, not your employer. . At Zurich we highly value the experience and know-how of our employees. We support your need for change and offer a wide range of opportunities across all business areas.. . Additional Information. . Currently remote-based due to restrictions. Work location is Dublin. Position is Dublin-based but occasional travel may be required to other Zurich locations.. . If you value an exciting and varied working environment and meet the above requirements, then we are looking forward to receiving your application.. . Recruiting Consultant: Jemma Doran. . Hiring Manager: Michael Frawley. . Closing date for applications is 2nd March 2021. Early applications are encouraged as interviews may take place before closing date. At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 39,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.. . About Us. . At Lilly, we make a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing, and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that we do are our talented and motivated professionals. Today more than 700 are based at our Global Business Solutions centre in Little Island, Cork. There we boast a vibrant workforce made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages.. . Established in 2010 to gain efficiencies in Finance GBS Cork quickly excelled in its financial mandate, allowing the Cork leadership to ask, how can we apply these processes to other areas of the business? And so the GBS we have today was born, still leading in finance, but also evolving and expanding into diverse Business Service functions.. . This, along with the current physical expansion of the Little Island campus, means there has never been a more exciting time to be part of the GBS story! The new Island Hall facility will extend our overall capacity where Lilly will continue to offer a premium workspace across both buildings.. . Our benefits package includes healthcare, pension and life assurance benefits, subsidised canteen, wellbeing facilities, Educational Assistance, travel subsidies, car-pooling incentives, bike to work scheme, on-site parking and much more.. . At the GBS, it’s not just about what we do today, but how we can continuously improve and innovate for present and future operations.. . Above all, it’s about being part of an open, welcoming and inclusive culture, one that is further enhanced by the dedication of our committees - Culture Club, Diversity & Inclusion, Sports & Social, Corporate Social Responsibility, Health Safety & Environment and Food.. . “We see Cork as an integral part of our productivity agenda. If you are excited by new opportunity and new scope, you are working at the right place.” – Dave Ricks, CEO Lilly. . Purpose. . The role of a P2P Data/Reporting Analyst for is an integral role to drive P2P Transformation in 2021. The P2P Data/Reporting Analyst will manage processes from data collection through report generation to ensure the timely, complete, and accurate delivery of all required reporting.. . The person who fills this role will be responsible for leading data collection and reporting processes, and work to resolve inquiries in a manner that maximizes customer experience.. . Interact with various Teams, Towers and Business areas, to meet P2P’s reporting obligations.. Work towards established timelines around month end, quarter end and year end.. Ensure relevant analytics are conducted to provide confidence that the data are complete, accurate, and timely.. Lead the identification and implementation of process improvements.. Lead data quality governance processes.. . . Understand all relevant data, systems, policies / procedures, and reporting requirements. . Build a thorough understanding of P2P reporting requirements. Develop knowledge of systems and business processes to support data analysis and inquiry needs (data collection, processing & reporting). Develop awareness of various global reporting requirements; understand possible implications to reporting environment and make recommendations for system and business changes. . . Manage efforts to process and analyze P2P data that supports report delivery. . Act as P2P subject matter reporting expert, lead development of new capabilities and support other team members and business partners. Support the processing and analysis of P2P Data from applicable systems and processes. Manage data inquiries from internal customers, and manage issue resolution. Facilitate collection, management, and analysis of data, as necessary. Develop, document, communicate, and enforce data standards, as necessary. . . Collaborate and influence business & automations partners to accommodate new & changing reporting requirements. . Develop and maintain strong relationships / communication with global cross-functional business process and data owners (business & automation). Partner with business areas to understand data gaps and drive issues to closure; leverage partnerships to influence business process changes, where appropriate. Anticipate and understand impact of changes to sources systems on reporting capabilities, changes to reporting requirements on system needs, etc.. Provide ongoing consulting on data strategy (e.g., control design, operational processes, etc.), including potential impacts of expanding requirements. . . Compliance. . Understand and follow all compliance policies, laws, regulations and The Red Book.. Ensure adherence to all document retention requirements in line with Lilly Global Record Retention Schedule and any applicable local legal requirements, including filing, storing, archiving, and destroying documents at the end of the record retention period. Ensure all SOx and Operational controls are completed and followed to level required and within agreed timeframe.. Integrate compliance into daily activities.. Comply with any corrective actions.. Cooperate with investigations, monitoring and audits.. . . Personal Attributes. . Ability to handle complexity and utilize analytical skills, with attention to detail. Ability to effectively prioritize and complete key tasks and deliverables whilst also engaging others to achieve their deadlines towards compliance & change initiatives. Ability to communicate effectively & influence across all levels and disciplines of the organization. . . Minimum Qualification Requirements. . 3 years experience in P2P. Bachelors Degree or equivalent in Finance / Data Analytics.. Effective team member with ability to work across a diverse and cross-functional work group.. Must be flexible and adaptable to change. Demonstrated strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Advanced Research, analytical and issues resolution skills. Must be able to multi-task and work well under pressure. Developed good relationships with various levels of personnel in Lilly’s Financial organization and third party service providers. Proficient with Microsoft Office software (Excel, Word, Power Point etc…). . Systems. . Experience in MS Office. SAP Experience. Power BI. . . Additional Preferences. . Understanding of P2P Finance, data management, and project management principles. Experience working with global business partners. High degree of comfort working with Finance Data and in a technical environment. Demonstrated critical thinking; ability to think broadly and strategically. Proven initiative to prioritize deliverables, make decisions in a fast paced and complex environment, and deliver. Strong organizational and time management skills. Effective communication skills. Demonstrated teamwork and ability to work effectively across organizations. Demonstrated ability to develop, implement, and improve business processes and solutions. Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to develop and apply creative solutions. Knowledge of Financial reporting obligations, and understanding of evolving reporting landscape. Ability to analyse data in order to draw conclusions. . . COMPANY OVERVIEW:. . . . Founded in 2000, Analytic Partners (AP) has grown to be the independent global leader in analytics consulting and technology. We help top-tier companies adapt to the rapidly evolving world of data, analytics, and strategic and tactical data-driven decisioning.  We are fast growing with global operations across our full-service offices in New York City, Denver, Charlottesville, Dublin, Sydney, Hong Kong, Singapore, and Shanghai.  We are the premier provider of integrated analytic technology and services, leveraging adaptive modeling techniques to help companies generate better business results, drive growth, and, ultimately, grow closer to their customers. . . . . Analytic Partners is a Certified Women-Owned Business, and a recognized leader in marketing measurement and optimization, and named a Leader in The Forrester Wave™ Marketing Measurement and Optimization Q1 2020, with top ranks in Strategy and Current Offering categories among all evaluated vendors.. . . . OUR VALUES:. . . . Our differentiator is - Our People!  We hire the brightest talent and develop them into leaders. We foster a culture of PEOPLE, PASSION and GROWTH.  . . . . People: We value our people, clients, and partners. Passion: We love what we do. Growth: Unlimited growth means unlimited potential. . AP is a client-focused, team-oriented organization where innovation and results are rewarded, and individuals can chart the course of their own careers.. . . . TEAM & POSITION OVERVIEW:. . . .  The Client Engagement Team (CET) is the analytic and consultative backbone of Analytic Partners. We believe that the most successful way to service our clients is to employ a business model where the people who are partnering with the client are the same as the people who prepare, analyze, and deliver insightful, data-driven results and guide clients to use our technology solutions to make optimal decisions. Analytic Partners does not offshore or outsource any of our work; it is all done in-house. Therefore, this high-touch service requires a passion for analytics, balanced with strong communication, a consultative approach, and the ability to deliver a software plus services solution, all to enable our clients to grow their ROI. . . . . At Analytic Partners you will advise and partner with large, well-known businesses, many of which are Fortune 500 or 100 companies.  Your work will help influence their strategic and tactical planning for marketing and beyond, creating growth opportunities which are measured in the tens of millions of dollars.  We develop relationships with our clients and meet with senior audiences, from brand managers to media directors to CMOs and CEOs.  You will learn, measure, and be an expert on marketing, from the basics to contributing to the latest innovations and developments. Our impactful insights are derived from our ability to build accurate and predictive models. A deep understanding of our clients’ data and business, in combination with our customized approach, allows us to “solve the puzzle” of what drives sales, appointments, accounts, brand health, or whatever it is our client wants to do more of.. . . . The Marketing Science Analyst role covers a range of responsibilities in which you will lead the day-to-day elements of projects from building advanced analytic models that leverage Big Data to creating deliverables through presentations and technology that communicate impactful insights and recommendations to our clients.  You will be trained and resourced on our industry leading advanced analytics and big data solutions to help client companies generate better business results, drive growth, and, ultimately, grow closer to their customers.  You will work in a dynamic collaborative team environment on national and multi-national client business.. . . . YOU WILL OWN & COLLABORATE ON:. . . . Partner with clients to help them optimize marketing investments and more using sophisticated analytic methodologies combine with technology and advisory services. Regularly communicate with clients and additional partners to collect, harmonize & review data, build models, interpret results, and formulate key insights. Develop charts, reports and client presentations. Train and guide clients on the adoption of software to run simulations or optimizations for various types of investment planning scenarios. Ensure statistical models and all deliverables are of high quality and meet the internal quality control guidelines. Collaborate as part of a team to drive analyses and insights that lead to more informed decisions and improved business performance. Ensure AP meets or exceeds client expectations on both deliverable milestones and quality. Work with team to continuously evolve our statistical methodologies and develop new ways of efficiently and effectively solving complex client business problems. Collaborate with the Technology Engineering Team (R&D) to help develop new tools and capabilities. . QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE YOU WILL NEED:. . . . Fluent in a second European language highly preferred. Bachelor’s degree or above (ideal areas of study/related study include: Business Analytics and Management, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, and/or Marketing). 1-3+ years of experience with any combination of advanced and predictive analytics, marketing analytics, and analytic techniques for marketing, customer, and business applications. Experience working with big data; building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures, and data sets. Strong working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, and SQL; Additional tools such as VBA, R, and/or Python are a plus but not required. Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Experience working independently on analytical tasks to build a story. Comfortable working with a team developing and presenting presentations using insights derived from analytics. The ability to occasionally travel domestically and/or internationally. Strong verbal and written communication skills internally and externally. An understanding of how to use data to solve complex business questions and drive business solutions. .  . . . . You must be eligible to work in Ireland on an unlimited basis to be considered for this job.. . . . Show more

Job Title:                       Reinsurance Portfolio Analyst  . . Reporting to:                Reinsurance Manager . . Team:                              Reinsurance. . In business for over 50 years, FBD is one of Ireland’s largest property and casualty insurers, holding lead positions in its target markets. The Reinsurance Function falls under the remit of the Chief Underwriting Officer and works closely with the underwriting, claims, actuarial and finance departments. At its core, Stripe is a treasury company. We are seeking a Treasury Financial Risk Business Analyst to help us fulfill our mission of building the Global Payments and Treasury Network (GPTN), enabling our users to move money to and from their own user constituents and to understand and optimize these flows. Treasury is inextricably intertwined with our product suite; in order to continue to build novel and powerful products for our users, our own treasury capabilities must be excellent.. . To that end, Stripe is building a world class Treasury team focused on being fully automated and supremely lean. We work closely with Data Science, Treasury Engineering and Payments Infrastructure engineering teams to build great systems. We also work closely with product and finance teams to shape our understanding of how Stripe is performing as a business and what our best opportunities are for continued growth. We are looking for someone fantastic to join our fast growing team and to help us build integrated financial systems and processes, working alongside our business partners and our world-class engineers.. . You Will. . Design systems and data flows to support Treasury risk management system development. Collaborate with business stakeholders to translate business needs/ questions into functional requirements. Liaise with Accounting, Engineering, and other internal teams to ensure stakeholder alignment and appropriate controls. Partner with Engineering on the design of intraday risk engine capability in the GPTN - including the development of proprietary systems focused on observability as well as controls and alerting. Develop financial risk operating metrics in partnership with Data Science to provide regional observability into KRIs and KPIs.. Build dashboards and custom reports to track key metrics, empower other team members with data, and investigate business questions. Conduct deep dive analysis addressing key business questions and presenting them to stakeholders. Develop workflow processes and implement Treasury policies, procedures, and controls. Ensure regulatory compliance in our processes. . . Our Ideal Candidate Will Have. . 6+ years of finance experience. The ability to work with and synthesize extremely large data sets and previous systems design / project management / business analyst experience. An inclination to solve problems systematically via infrastructure and automation. A clear willingness to "roll up their sleeves" and dive into the details. The ability to work independently or with a small team. Flexibility with changing requirements in an evolving and fast-paced environment. Strong communication skills and an ability to build and leverage cross-functional relationships. A demonstrated ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with a high attention to detail. . . Nice To Haves. . Knowledge of payments industry. Experience with SQL, Oracle, Risk Management and Trading Systems. . . To Apply, Please Include. . A resume and LinkedIn profile.. Show more

Job Title. Data Architect. Job Purpose. . Fiserv is a global provider of financial services technology. Our clients include banks, thrifts, credit unions, securities broker dealers, leasing and finance companies, and retailers. In Nenagh, we are building the next generation of commerce infrastructure, services and analytics to support continued growth of our business.. . We Are Currently Looking At Expanding Our Technology Centre And Are Seeking To Talk To People Who Will Help Us To. . Create better experiences for users. Prioritize ease of use and functionality. Build and deploy new services. Ask questions of the biggest datasets. Be passionate, impactful and Be first. Join a team on a mission. . . Role Overview. . Responsible for evaluating the current state of the company’s databases and data systems. Analyse , identify new solutions to increase efficiency, performance and data insights . Designs database solutions to ensure company information is stored effectively and securely. Defines the overall data structure, including recovery, security, integration, backup, and capability specifications.. . Responsible for design and maintenance of Enterprise Data Model. Developing database solutions to store and retrieve company information data strategy. Analysing structural requirements for new software and applications. Works closely with data engineers in designing and building company data. We are looking for a Data Architect to build, optimize and maintain conceptual and logical database models. Creates database solutions, evaluates requirements, documents systems, designs integrations and data consumption layers including interfaces and reports.. . Primary Objectives. . Design and Maintenance of Enterprise data model. Analyses system requirements. Architectural designs of integration and migration methods for data. Develop database solutions to store and retrieve company information. Optimize new and current data systems. Design and implement effective database solutions and models to store and retrieve company data. Examine and identify database structural necessities by evaluating client operations, applications, and programming. Prepare accurate database design and architecture reports for management and executive teams. Recommend solutions to improve new and existing database systems. Educate staff members through training and individual support. Work as bridge between BA and developers translating BA requirements into technical solutions. Analysing and documenting business processes, system architecture and business/functional requirements. Creating standards, structures and data governance. Designing integration architecture including: data flow, process flow and ETL integrations. Documentation and design of data consumption layer including definition of reports, interfaces and Rest API architecture. Defining and supervising implementation of Enterprise Data Standards and good practices. Redesign the Integration, Rest API layer, Web services, Data flows between applications. . . Knowledge & Skills. . Proven 5 years work experience as a Data Architect, Data Scientist, Data/System Analyst or similar role. In-depth understanding of database structure principles. Experience gathering and analysing system requirements. Knowledge of data mining and segmentation techniques. Expertise in SQL and Oracle. Knowledge of DB tuning. Proven analytical skills. Familiarity with data visualization tools. Problem-solving attitude. Strong knowledge of database structure systems and data mining. Excellent organizational and analytical abilities.. Outstanding problem solver. Good written and verbal communication skills.. Experience in working across multiple business processes, systems and platforms. Experience with business process mapping/documentation, developing use cases, documenting system architecture and creating concept and context diagrams. Strong process documentation skills. Hands-on experience with Enterprise Architect or similar tool for UML modelling. Fluent English is a must. Nice to have knowledge of big data tools i.e Kafka, Spark, Mongo DB. About Lumen. . Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.. . The Role. . The Service Delivery Organization of Lumen is seeking a Lead Operations Analyst with a strong business acumen and the technical skills necessary to uncover and present insights to various business stakeholders. This position will report to the Sr Manager of Business Operations. The Lead Operations Analyst will use operations, sales, finance, and HR data to perform strategic analyses, and provide business insights that executives and functional team leaders can use to make better business decisions. This team member is expected to become an expert in how North American Operations works and recommended insightful recommendation on how to drive the business forward.. . The Main Responsibilities. . Lead Tactical Projects – Direct teams of subject matter experts to provide detailed requirements used to develop reporting or guide IT developers performing App development.. Lead Process Improvement Teams – Using data, guide stakeholder teams to detect process gaps in their area of responsibility and drive implementation of the improvement.. Business acumen - Ultimately the analyses we perform need to lead to insights and business decisions. It’s not enough to be able to pull data and create reports and dashboards that others have requested; our team needs to analyze the data and provide the bigger picture to help influence and drive business decisions. Problem-solving - Our stakeholders don’t always know the right question to ask. We often must figure out what the real question is or determine the desired outcome before conducting analysis. Communication skills – Possess the ability to explain complex analysis to executive team in simple, easy to understand language. Data visualization - Putting together visualizations that update automatically allows our team to only need to do something once, rather than on a daily/weekly/monthly basis. This role needs to be able to turn analysis into something that a non-technical person can easily understand.. SQL knowledge a bonus.. Analyzes operational data, identify process deficiencies and be able to tell the story using fact-based data.. Create reports, presentations and other communications that clearly convey the outputs from analysis and data discovery. Must be able to transform analytics into business insights and recommendations.. . . . Minimum. . What We Look For in a Candidate. . Bachelors or Equivalent and 6+ years related experience with Bachelors.. Experience with data mining, SQL and BI Tools.. Possess strong analytical skills with the ability to identify performance drivers and trends.. Extensive experience of transforming analysis into visualizations and recommendations to key stakeholders (Excel, Powerpoint, BI visuals).. Works effectively within tight deadlines and firm schedules.. Exhibits good business judgement with the ability to overcome obstacles and think strategically to solve business problems.. Ability to influence stakeholders to take strategic process improvement actions based on current process data.. . . Preferred. . Masters or Equivalent. 4+ years related experience with Masters. . . . At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 39,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.. . About Us. . At Lilly, we make a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing, and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that we do are our talented and motivated professionals. Today more than 700 are based at our Global Business Solutions centre in Little Island, Cork. There we boast a vibrant workforce made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages.. . Established in 2010 to gain efficiencies in Finance GBS Cork quickly excelled in its financial mandate, allowing the Cork leadership to ask, how can we apply these processes to other areas of the business? And so the GBS we have today was born, still leading in finance, but also evolving and expanding into diverse Business Service functions.. . This, along with the current physical expansion of the Little Island campus, means there has never been a more exciting time to be part of the GBS story! The new Island Hall facility will extend our overall capacity where Lilly will continue to offer a premium workspace across both buildings.. . Our benefits package includes healthcare, pension and life assurance benefits, subsidised canteen, wellbeing facilities, Educational Assistance, travel subsidies, car-pooling incentives, bike to work scheme, on-site parking and much more.. . At the GBS, it’s not just about what we do today, but how we can continuously improve and innovate for present and future operations.. . Above all, it’s about being part of an open, welcoming and inclusive culture, one that is further enhanced by the dedication of our committees - Culture Club, Diversity & Inclusion, Sports & Social, Corporate Social Responsibility, Health Safety & Environment and Food.. . “We see Cork as an integral part of our productivity agenda. If you are excited by new opportunity and new scope, you are working at the right place.” – Dave Ricks, CEO Lilly. . Purpose. . The role of a P2P Data/Reporting Analyst for is an integral role to drive P2P Transformation in 2021. The early months of this role will see the successful candidate being involved in major P2P Transformation projects.. . The P2P Data/Reporting Analyst will manage processes from data collection through report generation to ensure the timely, complete, and accurate delivery of all required reporting.. . The person who fills this role will be responsible for leading data collection and reporting processes, and work to resolve inquiries in a manner that maximizes customer experience.. . Key Responsibilities. . As a key user of Lilly’s P2P Data Sources, set up and manage parameters which generate all Global P2P Finance Reporting and Controls for internal users.. Interact with various Teams, Towers and Business areas, to meet P2P’s reporting obligations.. Work towards established timelines around month end, quarter end and year end.. Ensure relevant analytics are conducted to provide confidence that the data are complete, accurate, and timely.. Lead the identification and implementation of process improvements.. Lead data quality governance processes.. . Understand all relevant data, systems, policies / procedures, and reporting requirements. . Build a thorough understanding of P2P reporting requirements. Develop knowledge of systems and business processes to support data analysis and inquiry needs (data collection, processing & reporting). Develop awareness of various global reporting requirements; understand possible implications to reporting environment and make recommendations for system and business changes. . Manage efforts to process and analyze P2P data that supports report delivery. . Act as P2P subject matter reporting expert, lead development of new capabilities and support other team members and business partners. Support the processing and analysis of P2P Data from applicable systems and processes. Manage data inquiries from internal customers, and manage issue resolution. Facilitate collection, management, and analysis of data, as necessary. Develop, document, communicate, and enforce data standards, as necessary. . Collaborate and influence business & automations partners to accommodate new & changing reporting requirements. . Develop and maintain strong relationships / communication with global cross-functional business process and data owners (business & automation). Partner with business areas to understand data gaps and drive issues to closure; leverage partnerships to influence business process changes, where appropriate. Anticipate and understand impact of changes to sources systems on reporting capabilities, changes to reporting requirements on system needs, etc.. Provide ongoing consulting on data strategy (e.g., control design, operational processes, etc.), including potential impacts of expanding requirements. . Compliance. . Understand and follow all compliance policies, laws, regulations and The Red Book.. Ensure adherence to all document retention requirements in line with Lilly Global Record Retention Schedule and any applicable local legal requirements, including filing, storing, archiving, and destroying documents at the end of the record retention period. Ensure all SOx and Operational controls are completed and followed to level required and within agreed timeframe.. Integrate compliance into daily activities.. Comply with any corrective actions.. Cooperate with investigations, monitoring and audits.. . Personal Attributes. . Ability to handle complexity and utilize analytical skills, with attention to detail. Ability to effectively prioritize and complete key tasks and deliverables whilst also engaging others to achieve their deadlines towards compliance & change initiatives. Ability to communicate effectively & influence across all levels and disciplines of the organization. . . Minimum Qualification Requirements. . 3 years experience in P2P. Bachelors Degree or equivalent in Finance / Data Analytics.. Effective team member with ability to work across a diverse and cross-functional work group.. Must be flexible and adaptable to change. Demonstrated strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Advanced Research, analytical and issues resolution skills. Must be able to multi-task and work well under pressure. Developed good relationships with various levels of personnel in Lilly’s Financial organization and third party service providers. Proficient with Microsoft Office software (Excel, Word, Power Point etc…). . Systems. . Experience in MS Office. SAP Experience. Power BI. . . Additional Preferences. . Understanding of P2P Finance, data management, and project management principles. Experience working with global business partners. High degree of comfort working with Finance Data and in a technical environment. Demonstrated critical thinking; ability to think broadly and strategically. Proven initiative to prioritize deliverables, make decisions in a fast paced and complex environment, and deliver. Strong organizational and time management skills. Effective communication skills. Demonstrated teamwork and ability to work effectively across organizations. Demonstrated ability to develop, implement, and improve business processes and solutions. Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to develop and apply creative solutions. Knowledge of Financial reporting obligations, and understanding of evolving reporting landscape. Ability to analyse data in order to draw conclusions. . Primary Job Function. . Support the Enterprise Analytics solution by ensuring data is clean, correctly mapped and processed according to business expectations and an enterprise data model.. Support EPD functions in the definition and implementation of information needs to enable business strategies by working directly with business stakeholders (across functional areas). Develop technology initiatives to deliver analytics’ expected benefits and capabilities from data perspective.. Ensure integrity, scalability and transportability of implemented solutions. Ensure solutions align with corporate IT services and policies (data standards, data modeling tools, ETL standards). Be part of Master Data Governance, including Master Data Management activities through data flows and data build.. Member of the Enterprise Analytics Master Data Team. . . Core Job Responsibilities. . Understand EPD information needs in the context of business strategies and priorities. Participate in business workshops, lead data stream to define, design, and document data needs. Continues improve user experience and suggest adjustments in business processes. Ensure improvement of data management activities to release business teams from repetitive non-value-added activities. Identify and reconcile inconsistencies in data definitions. Work to identify master data (entities and attributes) and capture how data is interpreted by users in various parts of the organization.. Implement business and technology initiatives to fulfil data needs. Maintain network with business users (Data Stewards) by providing trainings and updates from data tools. . . Education And Experience Required. . Minimum of three to four years of hands on experience in working as DWH/BI senior analyst or similar in medium to large industries.. Minimum of two full cycles of global analytics initiatives.. Ideally certified in one SAP functional module.. Ideally one end-to-end ERP SAP implementation cycle.. Experience in Data Governance projects.. Experience in Data Linage projects.. Extensive experience in SQL and one of the following databases: Oracle, MSSQL, DB2, PostgreSQL.. Extensive experience in working in AWS environment, deep knowledge of Glue, Redshift.. Experience with ETL (IICS, IDQ) and DWH/ BI projects.. Fluent in English (written and verbal). Mathematical knowledge for Data Analysis.. Knowledge and experience with Informatica technology (Informatica IDQ, MDM, PowerCenter, IICS). Knowledge and experience with BI tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik etc.). Knowledge and experience with Data Linage tools.. Well-organized way of working, efficiency in solving complex issues.. Experience in pharmaceutical industry would be an asset.. Experience in scripting languages (Perl …). Knowledge and experience of AI / Machine Learning solutions would be an asset.. . . For 70 years, Charles River employees have worked together to assist in the discovery, development and safe manufacture of new drug therapies. When you join our family, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether your background is in life sciences, finance, IT, sales or another area, your skills will play an important role in the work we perform. In return, we’ll help you build a career that you can feel passionate about.. . We are seeking an experienced Senior Analytical Analyst for our Biologics Division located in Ballina, Co. Mayo, Ireland.. . This role shall report to the Analytical Services Manager and the main duties & responsibilities shall be:. . Assist in setting up the cell culture methods like ELISPOT or microneutralization assay including development and validation of the methods where necessary;. Carrying out test method procedures like generic ELISA, MAT assay, microplate assays or clients specific immunoassays.. Receipt and processing of test samples in LIMS.. Safe and compliant disposal of all laboratory generated waste.. Generation of GMP compliant SOPs, Protocols and reports.. Carry out data calculations and basic statistics.. Assist in internal, regulatory and client visits/audits and respond to findings.. Sourcing, purchasing and stocking consumables, standards and reagents required for testing.. . The following are minimum requirements related to the Senior Analytical Analyst position:. . M.Sc. in a relevant science discipline (e.g. Cell Culture or Immunoassays). A minimum of 2 years relevant experience in Scientific Research preferably within a GMP regulated environment (EMEA/FDA) within the Pharmaceutical, Medical Device, CRO Industry.. Experience in in-vitro bioassays and project management highly desirable.. Experience in immunoassays requirements highly desirable.. Analytical techniques and cell culture experience essential.. . . . Job Summary. . About Biologics Testing Solutions. . With more than 50 years of experience and proven regulatory expertise, the Charles River Biologics group can address challenging projects for biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies worldwide. Offering a variety of services such as contamination and impurity testing, protein characterzation, bioassays, viral clearance studies and stability and lot release programs, we support clients throughout the biologic development cycle, from the establishment and characterization of cell banks through preclinical and clinical studies to marketed products. Whether clients need stand-alone services, a unique package of testing, or insourced support, our Biologics group can create a custom solution to suit their needs. Each year more than 20,000 biologic testing reports are sent each and over 200 licenses products are supported by our biologics testing solutions team.. . About Charles River. . Charles River is an early-stage contract research organization (CRO). We have built upon our foundation of laboratory animal medicine and science to develop a diverse portfolio of discovery and safety assessment services, both Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and non-GLP, to support clients from target identification through preclinical development. Charles River also provides a suite of products and services to support our clients’ clinical laboratory testing needs and manufacturing activities. Utilizing this broad portfolio of products and services enables our clients to create a more flexible drug development model, which reduces their costs, enhances their productivity and effectiveness to increase speed to market.. . With over 14,000 employees within 80 facilities in 20 countries around the globe, we are strategically positioned to coordinate worldwide resources and apply multidisciplinary perspectives in resolving our client’s unique challenges. Our client base includes global pharmaceutical companies, biotechnology companies, government agencies and hospitals and academic institutions around the world. And in 2018, revenue increased by 22% to $2.27 billion from $1.86 billion in 2017.. . At Charles River, we are passionate about our role in improving the quality of people’s lives. Our mission, our excellent science and our strong sense of purpose guide us in all that we do, and we approach each day with the knowledge that our work helps to improve the health and well-being of many across the globe. We have proudly supported the development of ~85% of the drugs approved by the FDA in 2018.. Show more

You have 3-7 or more years of related work experience, including 3 or more years of people management experience.. You have leadership skills, including coaching, teambuilding, conflict resolution, and management.. You have project management skills including time and risk management, resource prioritization.. 3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.. . Job Description. . Job Title - Supply Chain Systems Business Analyst. . Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World. . Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with 93,000 other curious, creative 3Mers.. . “3M’s culture is driven by curious, spirited and collaborative people who are constantly asking ‘What if?’ And the many talents of 3Mers around the globe have me incredibly excited about what’s to come next.” – Kristen Ludgate, senior vice president of Human Resources at 3M. . The Impact You’ll Make in this Role. . The Supply Chain Systems Business Analyst role supports the Advanced Wound Therapy (AWT) portfolio within 3M’s Medical Solutions Division and is responsible for providing business intelligence and ERP system expertise to various global supply chain teams. A successful analyst will coordinate with, participate on, and lead cross functional teams in order to provide automated data solution that enhance end user experience.. . Here, You Will Make An Impact By. . As Supply Chain Systems Business Analyst, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.. . Developing business intelligence capabilities within our global supply chain systems. Providing automated data solutions to global users.. Maintaining business intelligence systems by partnering with IT, monitoring automated processes, identifying data discrepancies, and rapidly resolving issues.. Providing education/training to the plant/staff in the areas of supply chain management, demand management, or planning tools. Participating on global process improvement teams.. Investigating process gaps within supply chain systems, determining root cause, and analyzing options to mitigate risk.. Handling non-routine and difficult inquiries. Adapting differing techniques and methods to develop solutions for a variety of complex issues. Applies analytical skills for analysis and interpretation of trends or data generated by company reporting systems, statistical results, or other information collection systems. Most complex problem solving may include the use of experience, individual reasoning, and research which may deviate from standard techniques and practices.. Implementing solutions within our supply chain systems in order to enhance 3M’s global supply chain processes and improve the accuracy of the Master Production Plan.. Establishing and tracking metrics to measure the health of our supply chain systems.. Managing the item set-up and maintenance process within the ERP system for all planning and related supply chain attributes.. Creating opportunities and innovative solutions to improve the user experience of our supply chain teams.. . . Your Skills And Expertise. . To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:. . Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Business, Statistics, Engineering or related field.. Proven relevant work experience in supply chain planning, procurement, operations, logistics, inventory management, or demand planning in a private, public, government, or military environment.. Experience working with ERP, MRP II, MRP, SCP, APS, or DRP systems.. Experience working with and analyzing large sets of data. Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite of applications (Excel, Access, Outlook, etc.). . . Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:. . Strong analytical skills with experience in visual display, reporting to senior leadership and influencing the outcome.. Ability to establish and maintain effective interpersonal working relationships with internal customers, internal/external suppliers, and fellow team members at all levels.. Experience using automated purchase orders and supplier schedules.. Experience Using Oracle, ASCP, or SAP.. APICS CPIM or relevant professional planning association certification.. . . Travel: 10% expected. . Role Location: Athlone, Ireland with 50% home working availble. . Remuneration. . Salary - €high-reaching dependent on skills and experience plus excellent benefits package.. . Shift Allowance – Up to 50% work from home authorized.. . Key Benefits Include. . 25 days paid annual holiday, rising to 30 days with service, plus Bank Holidays. Pension Scheme with up to 10% employer contribution. Private Health Care. Life Assurance Scheme 4 x salary. General Employee Stock Purchase Plan providing the opportunity to purchase 3M stock at discounted rates. Reduced subscriptions on various insurance schemes. Employee Assistance Programme. Financial support for further education. FlexAbility - empowers employees to adjust when and where they work – in ways that reflect individual roles, personal circumstances, and help to drive business outcomes and work-life balance. . . Employment Statement. . At 3M, diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people!. . As an equal opportunity employer, 3M will not discriminate against any applicant.. . If you want to discover more about D&I at 3M, please visit http://go.3M.com/4i9C. . Supporting Your Well-being. . 3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.. . Resources for You. . For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers.. . Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.. . Sogeti is recognised as a world leader in Digital Assurance and Testing. We’re known for continually looking to drive value and new developments in quality assurance that enable us to deliver innovation and testing excellence for our clients. Our team utilise the latest advancements in Artificial Intelligence, Cognitive Learning and Data Analytics to achieve greater speed and quality across our engagements. At Sogeti Ireland, we work with our clients to deliver solutions that meet their business needs.. . . . . We are looking to hire a Functional Test Analyst with a minimum of 1 years experience in Testing. You must have ISTQB Performance Tester certification or equivalent. Client interaction experience is required, so you will possess excellent client engagement and communication skills and have experience of the full project lifecycle. Good analysis and problem-solving skills along with the ability to work under reasonable pressure is a must.. . . . . Responsibilities. . Review user stories / requirements, functional design specifications ad project documentation.. Identify, create and prioritise Test cases. Define and prepare test data.. Execute test criteria and interpret results.. Use of Test management and Issue tracking tools e.g. JIRA, Zephyr.. Peer review Test cases/scripts from other team members.. Support business users during UAT testing.. Report test status to Test Lead. Testing of Web Services, XML, Databases and SQL, reports and Batch jobs etc.. . . . . Requirements:. . A minimum of 1 year experience as a Functional Tester. ISTQB Performance Tester certification or equivalent. . . . . About the Company. . . . . At Sogeti, we know how to create value with technology- it’s our passion. We work closely with clients and partners to take full advantage of the opportunities of technology. We mobilize expert teams that create custom solutions from existing and emerging technology. Our value is in our approach, characterized by the speed with which we deliver specialist solutions in digital assurance and testing, data & analytics, digital & development, cybersecurity and life sciences.. . Disruption is the norm in today’s digital and business environment. How quickly companies respond to change determines their future success – and their ability to realize rapid value from existing and future technology is crucial to this. At Sogeti, we collaborate across a global network to build innovations that push boundaries. But it’s the way we work with clients that sets us apart. Our client model means we can be hands-on from day one, getting to know our customers and their businesses intimately.. . . . . We embrace the value of diversity within Sogeti and the entrepreneurial spirit of our people. If you’re looking to join a company with a proven track record of success and that deeply values its people, Sogeti Ireland offers the opportunity for you to grow and advance.. . Sogeti Ireland- where people matter and results count.. . Show more

STRATEGIC DATA ANALYST, COMMERCIAL OPERATIONS – CONTRACT. . . . . Who We Are:. . . . . 2K develops and publishes interactive entertainment globally for console systems, handheld gaming devices and personal computers, including smartphones and tablets. 2K is a leading publisher of today’s most popular gaming genres and most well-known for critically acclaimed game franchises like NBA 2K, WWE 2K, Bioshock, Borderlands, Evolve, XCOM and the beloved Sid Meier’s Civilization.. . . . . This role is part of the 2K Commercial Operations team that is responsible for its P&L, business strategy, and operations globally. We partner across the organization through influence and relationships to orchestrate a unified, effective, and scalable effort. At any given moment we are the supporter, leader, approver, and/or responsible party with other internal and external teams. This is a contract role based in the 2K Games Dublin office which is in the heart of Dublin city. This role is 80% an analyst role, 20% a strategy role with life cycle management, the emphasis and crucial part of this role is the 20% strategy and life cycle management.. . . . . What We Need:. . . . . This role is pivotal in improving business performance leveraging on raw data and translating into actionable business insights that impact daily business decisions. With a deep understanding of our business and product goals the role involves skew planning to delve deep into project, content, promotion and KPI’s throughout the year. Developing effective analytical models and frameworks to optimize business decision making, collecting data directly from company data sources (i.e., SQL, Tableau) and effectively collaborating and communicating across all major functions to improve business performance. The role requires an agile mindset, with a high level of ability in data visualization. Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, relishes working with different teams, is comfortable with ambiguity, and, above all else, is passionate about data and analytics.. . . . . You are a structured problem-solver and data-driven decision maker.. You take a detailed, results-driven approach to executing recommendations and building cross- functional influence.. You work very well with colleagues across functions, geographies, and skillsets to orchestrate and communicate a coherent strategy and execution.. You enjoy looking at the big picture and then translating that to specific execution that you analyze and iterate on to improve.. You are great at telling a thoughtful story to describe and evangelize your view while welcoming and incorporating feedback from stakeholders.. You enjoy structuring an ambiguous and complex problem and testing-and-learning from hypotheses.. You have an analytical background and operational experience achieving results and executing growth plans in dynamic, complex situations with a range of stakeholders.. . . . . What You Will Do:. . . . . You will focus on business strategy and lifecycle management, forming a 360- degree view of our business, analyzing results, and forming strategic opinions.. You will become a go-to data expert within Commercial Operations focusing on optimizing product lifecycles for profitability, analyzing and solving problems at their root, and stepping back to understand the broader context of the business.. You will be responsible for several projects in the portfolio, forecasting product performance in the short, medium, and long term to understand current and predict future product performance.. You will have the capability to drive appropriate action against risks and opportunities.. Develop and report KPIs, models, and analyses for commercial/user behavior insights and to rally teams to recommended actions.. You will evaluate and identify opportunities and challenges with game performance (user, gameplay, systems, monetization, telemetry) and create compelling summaries on how various team can use these insights to improve performance.. Competitive analyses to benchmark internal product performance and help size market opportunities for new titles.. . . . . Who We Think Will Be a Great Fit:. . . . . You love gaming.. You are a creative, systematic and curious thinker who is passionate about leveraging data to deliver actionable insights that impact daily business decisions.. You bring an analytical mindset and are open-minded and seek to disprove your own hypotheses.. You can use/adapt advanced analytical tools and techniques to support data-driven decision making.. You are equally comfortable in discovery and production phases of a project and thrive in the start-up stage and scaling stage of business operations to drive growth.. An excellent communicator you excel when working in a collaborative team environment at all levels of an organization.. You enjoy and excel at evangelizing insights, organizing teamwork, and persuading colleagues, peers, and leaders to action.. You create great chemistry with others, are purposeful and dedicated with your energy, and raise everyone’s game around you. You prize team success over individual achievement.. . . . . What Skills Are Needed:. . . . . 3+ years of professional experience in a commercially driven data/business analyst role.. Strong analytical, quantitative skills and business judgement to model sophisticated scenarios and apply insights to strategy and planning.. Experience presenting to C Suite executives.. Experience or a deep interest in the Video games industry and knowledge of console and PC games.. Knowledge and/or application of Statistics and Machine Learning is a plus.. Have experience deploying analytics to drive decision making ideally in the context of product lifecycle management.. Technically not a “skill”, you do need to be comfortable working 10am-6:30pm to enable greater connection with your US HQ.. Show more

The database market is massive (the IDC estimates it to be $89B+ by 2024!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. The MongoDB community is transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.. . MongoDB is looking for an Accounting Operations Senior Analyst to interface directly with cross-functional finance/operations teams to identify their needs and work on implementing new or updating existing business systems and processes. As an internally focused "Product Manager" and part of the Accounting Operations team, this role works closely with business system admins/developers to optimize systems and processes that drive the company. The Accounting Operations team focuses on the digital transformation of the finance department. Many of the projects focus on automating Accounting related tasks. This role should be comfortable with ambiguity and can "connect the dots" using their experience and expertise to build process solutions. This role will have high visibility into multiple parts of the organization, including but not limited to Accounting, Finance, Deal Desk, Legal, Professional Services, and Business Systems and work on operational initiatives that will have a direct impact on the company's strategic goals.. . The right candidate will have. . . 4+ years of experience on a corporate accounting team. A proven track record of bringing about process improvements to enterprise-wide business processes. Demonstrated experience in requirement gathering, documentation, cross-functional work, and project management. Ability to manage varied and at times conflicting stakeholder needs and requirements for new initiatives. Ability to recognize patterns across internal requirements and leverage them to provide solutions with maximal impact. Experience with developing best-in-class business processes to optimize use of enterprise SaaS solutions including but not limited to Netsuite, Salesforce, FinancialForce, and Xactly. Intrinsic drive to seek constant improvement for our IT solutions and business processes.. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Knowledge of internal controls and compliance requirements. Experience working in a complex enterprise SaaS sales company (Plus). Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or business administration. . . Position Responsibilities. . . Documenting business requirements into user and functional requirements and driving momentum with project and internal stakeholders to ensure timely project execution. Formulating and defining the objectives and scope of business systems as well as evaluating and contrasting platforms as solutions for new business requirements whilst taking specific strengths and limitations into consideration. Ability to create positive relationships and influence internal and external customers. Serving as the single point of contact on behalf of Accounting Operations for large cross-functional projects, as well as an individual contributor for specific high-value low effort tasks. Creating documentation on product descriptions, policies, procedures, workflows and user guides. Supporting research, analysis, and development of new concepts and emerging technologies. . . To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!. . To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.. . MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer. Show more

Introduction. At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.. . Your Role and Responsibilities. The IBM Legal department and other internal business leaders rely on sound fact-based information to make decisions pertaining to crimes and other illegal activities affecting IBM, joint investigations with external investigative bodies, and other contentious matters. Investigations professionals are trained in the rules of evidence, investigative techniques, and relevant laws to perform as 'fact finder' and investigations liaison for IBM. As a Senior International Investigator you will Plan, coordinate, and conduct investigations of alleged and suspected violations of law including theft, fraud, computer crimes, and workplace violence. Procures information to assist senior leaders in understanding IBM's exposures in all matters under investigation.. Serve as subject matter experts on investigative strategies, and provides advice and counsel to the business about appropriate approaches for individual engagements. Employs interview techniques to question internal and external individuals about facts pertaining to matters under investigation. An established relationship with law enforcement and other investigative bodies enables the Investigations team to act as liaison to all external investigators.. Where appropriate manage relations with other investigative bodies within IBM as well as working closely with the internal intelligence and insider risk functions. Is able to work with all different units and, where necessary, provide leadership. An investigator always works as part of the global team. Investigators manage complex investigations as projects, engaging all relevant stakeholders and leading the investigation to conclusion. This involves compiling complex facts into digestible reports for internal, executive, and external consumption, and analyzing past engagements for continuous improvement, and giving testimony before judicial and legislative bodies in legal proceedings pertaining to relevant investigations. Additionally the investigator conducts a root-cause-analysis to identify underlying issues that resulted in an incident or enabled policy violations, and articulate and supervise the implementation of improvements to IBM's control posture. Also responsible for the evaluation of new investigative aids and techniques, and for advising the business on the appropriateness of employing new approaches within IBM. Information collected and maintained may be subject to legal, regulatory, or corporate policies; practitioners must be aware of all relevant provisions and maintain information accordingly.. . Required Technical and Professional Expertise. . Experience as a Senior Criminal Investigator is a prerequisite for this work. Readiness to travel up to 20% travel annually. Professional Criminal Police accredited interviewing skills and interrogation techniques are required. Must be able to relate and present cases, to appropriate external authorities including Law Enforcement officials in any EMEA country. Good IT skills across Microsoft™and Apple™operating systems, including standard Office tools such as Word, Excel etc. Demonstrate innovative and creative thinking as well as problem-solving skills.. Demonstration of a continuing ability to self-teach. Ability to take end-to-end ownership of engagements. Attention to detail and structured mindset to manage information logically. Strong team player comfortable in joining a small distributed team but with the ability to work independently. Generally a strong affinity with Information Technology, specifically understanding of the cybercrime environment. Good understanding of the current cyber-crime environment. . . Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise. . Experience in the hands-on review and analysis of potentially large volumes digital data. Experience in the use of analytical tools, e.g., IBM i2 Analyst Notebook, to analyze and present data. Experience in working in a multi-national company. Home office work environment is preferred. Lead / manage inter-disciplinary teams as part of investigations and projects. . This role can be filled by a candidate from any EU country, candidates must be based in Europe.. About Business UnitIBM Corporate Headquarters (CHQ) team represents a variety of functions such as marketing, finance, legal, operations, HR, and more, all working together to solve some of the world's most complex problems, help our clients achieve success and build collaborative work environments for IBMers.. . Your Life @ IBMWhat matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?. . Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.. . Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.. . About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.. . Location StatementFor additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.. . Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Advanced knowledge of SQL and at least good knowledge of another data analytics tool like Tableau, R, Python, etc.;. Being able to do in-depth analyzes like for example customer lifetime value, cohort analysis, sales forecast, customer segmentation, customer churn modelling;. Experience in using data analysis in a commercial environment;. . . Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs. Show more
